wine_name: McGregor 2007 Rob Roy Red Red (Finger Lakes)
desc: Hints of black coffee, dried lavender and herb add punch to the lean plum and cherry flavors of this medium-bodied Cabernet Franc blend. Brisk on the palate, with an herbaceous, green note that persists, it finishes firm, with a chalky coating of tannins.
Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US

wine_name: Nectar Of The Dogs 2017 3 Dogs White (Santa Barbara County)
desc: There is a pleasant tightness to the nose of this obscure blend of Viognier, Gewürztraminer and Muscat Canelli, with hints of crushed rock as well as lemon-pith aromas. The palate is quite ripe, with loads of pear and apples and a slight smoke tone.
Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US

desc: Here is a fresh expression of Pinot Bianco from the Lombardy region of northern Italy that exhibits sweet aromas of peach and apricot followed by almond honey and white flower. In the mouth, this crisp white wine shows a touch of sourness.
Rich and ripe, with fine-tuned layers of pear, melon, citrus, apple, herb and pretty toast notes. Well balanced and refined, the wine finishes long, with a tangy, fresh edge to the vibrant flavors.
Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US

desc: Racy and fragrant, this vibrant white is loaded with finesse and tension, opening with aromas of citrus, wild herb and a whiff of honeysuckle. On the elegant, tangy palate, crisp acidity accompanies juicy pineapple, white grapefruit and succulent white peach alongside an energizing saline note.

As Australian vineyards go, this isn't that old, having been planted in 1971. Chocolate and vanilla shadings frame bowls of mixed berries in this full-bodied, powerful wine. It finishes long and intense, outlined by dusty tannins.

Dark, crusty and minty on the nose, with obvious oak. The palate is tannic as a drill, with hard blackberry and herbal flavors. Toasty and peppery tasting on the finish, which is tough and drawing in feel.

Aromas of baked plum are joined by earthy whiffs of truffle, leather, game and cured meat. The aromas carry over to the ripe, dense palate along with fleshy black cherry, anise, mocha and mint. Velvety tannins provide the framework while a confectionary note backs up the finish. Drink 2017–2022.

A hint of rose petal breathes exotic perfume into this granite-laced Cabernet Franc. Ripe black cherry and graham cracker notes soften the palate and round out a moderately long, spicy finish. Drink now through 2017.
Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US

wine_name: Cave de Turckheim 2012 Hengst Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
desc: Lifted hints of chamomile and apple peel rise straight from the glass. The palate has the same streamlined citrus focus and just homes in on that sleek dry apple freshness that seem to be a dynamic force at the center of this wine. The flavors are concentrated and totally dominated by utter lemon freshness, tart and vivid to the last. Lovely now but with further potential. Drink now through 2030.

wine_name: B.R. Cohn 2009 Silver Label Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
desc: Medium-bodied and easy drinking, this Cabernet opens with yeasty red-fruit aromas and a touch of smoky oak, before finishing clean. A very good Cabernet Sauvignon that should be fairly easy to find.
Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US

wine_name: Château Haut Canteloup 2017  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux
desc: This dry wine has firm tannins and old oak flavors. The wine is solid and will likely remain dry as it develops.
Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France

wine_name: Baron Knyphausen 2011 Erbacher Michelmark Erste Lage Riesling (Rheingau)
desc: Hints of honey lend warmth to zesty aromas of lemon, lime and tangerine on this dry, steely wine. The palate is delicate, with tart notes of yellow peach and quince, but textured with streaks of mineral. Honed lemon-lime acidity leads a long, bracing finish.

wine_name: Dutton Estate 2009 Dutton Palms Vineyard Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
desc: Flashy and flamboyant, but smells and tastes overoaked, with buttered toast, caramel and vanilla meringue notes swamping the underlying tangerine, lemon and mango fruit. Drink now.
Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US

desc: This wine gives the impression of having been pushed just a bit too far, with a nose and palate dominated by vanilla and mocha notes imparted by small oak barrels. Nonetheless, black cherry and strawberry flavors manage to peek through on the palate, supporte by a cushion of lush tannins. A bright cherry note makes for a nice finish.

90–92. Barrel Sample. Rich while also intensely structured, this wine is already showing a delicious, open character. The acidity shines through the wine's sweetness, giving lift to the decadent spiced fruit tones. Drink from 2023.

wine_name: Syncline 2005 Cuvée Elena Red Wine Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
desc: This blend is concentrated and meaty. It perfectly captures and combines the raspberry intensity of the Grenache, the brambleberry fruit of the Mourvèdre and the peppery smoke and spice of the Syrah. Somehow winemaker James Mantone coaxes something akin to French garrigue out of the grapes as well, making this one of a handful of Washington Rhônes that really capture those elusive French herbal highlights.
Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US

wine_name: Domaines Schlumberger 2002 Les Princes Abbés Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
desc: Plump in the mouth, this is a straightforward wine but a clean, fresh, enjoyable one. Aromas are of yellow stone fruit and citrus. It offers core flavors of grapefruit and orange, couched in a soft cloud of honey.

wine_name: Wither Hills 2016 Rarangi Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
desc: This is solid, well-made Savvy. White grapefruit and red-currant aromas and flavors are textbook for the variety, while the medium body and long, stony finish also tick the boxes. Drink now.

wine_name: William Heritage 2016 Estate Grown Chenin Blanc (Outer Coastal Plain)
desc: Extremely pale in this glass, this has an unusual nose comprised of dried flowers, grass clippings and mulch. With a watery mouthfeel, it is sweet upfront in flavors of ripe lemon and lychee, while the finish is clipped leaving a sudden dryness in the mouth.
Appellation: Outer Coastal Plain, New Jersey, US

desc: Smells great, with just the right mix of upfront green apples and the spicy vanillins of smoky oak. Enters the palate with apple and peach flavors and a rich, creamy texture that has extra weight from lees aging. This friendly, polished Chard is as good as many more expensive ones.
Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US

wine_name: Woodstock Collection NV Honey Pie White (California)
desc: Fashion designer/vintner Richard Hirsh is aiming for the mass market with this approachable if slightly sweet blend. Its wide appeal is the result of sun-filled fruit, showing honey, baked apple, orange blossom and tropical notes on the nose. It's soft on the palate, with candied apple, brown sugar and lemongrass flavors.

This blends 55% Grenache with 38% Syrah and 7% Mourvèdre. Compressed fruit leather and oak provide a texture of gritty tannin and full, fleshy and distinctly savory flavor, dotted in violet aromas and strawberry jam.
This is thin and uninspiring, but it's dry, with watery berry and spice flavors.

wine_name: Inconceivable 2014 After the Floods Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
desc: The aromas offer varietal notes of dried and fresh herb, along with whiffs of spice and cherry. The flavors are somewhat lighter in style, with the tannins having a grainy feel.
Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US

desc: On the nose, this full of spice, char, and black fruit with a hint of barnyard. There's a hint of green bramble, however, that persists on the soft black cherry palate as well, adding a sour, stalky note in the mid palate.

wine_name: Oakville East 2012 Core Stone Cabernet Franc-Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
desc: With a slight preponderance of Cabernet Sauvignon to Cabernet Franc, this is a voluptuously smoky wine, rich in graham cracker, marshmallow and cedar. Moderate in oak and tannin, it brings full-bodied flavors to life slowly in the glass, finishing in leather and chocolate.

Shows the ripeness and concentrated tannins this mountain vineyard is known for, with a flood of blackberry, black pepper and smoky oak flavors. Could be firmer and crisper in structure, but it's a nice, dry, full-bodied Syrah to drink now.
Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US

wine_name: Fattoria La Rivolta 2009 Terre di Rivolta Riserva  (Aglianico del Taburno)
desc: This Aglianico opens with aromas of new oak, vanilla, chocolate and overripe black fruit, all of which carry over to the one-dimensional palate. It seems tired, and the sugary sweetness, dense concentration and evident alcohol give the wine a lumbering character.
Appellation: Aglianico del Taburno, Southern Italy, Italy

desc: This blend of Nero d'Avola and Cabernet Sauvignon has aromas of dark-skinned fruit and cooking spice that carry over to the simple palate alongside a hint of green peppercorn. It's easygoing, with laid-back tannins. Drink soon.

Motto Piane delivers a huge and sophisticated style (thanks to late-harvest fruit) with enormous intensity and thick glycerin streaks visible down the side of the glass. Aromas here include crushed white peppercorn, dried sage, almond paste and mature fruit.

wine_name: Jada Vineyard & Winery 2014 1149 Rosé of Mourvèdre (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
desc: Petal pink in the glass, this wine was specifically grown to be a rosé by winemaker David Galzignato. The nose is pretty with bubble gum, strawberry, raspberry and a bit of lime peel, and the palate offers flavors of ruby-red grapefruit and lemon juice, with bright acidity throughout.
Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US

desc: Charles Krug's style remains the same over the decades, producing balanced, dry table wines capable of some aging. This Cab is tannic and a bit austere now, with suggestions of blackberries and cherries. But the structure is very fine, especially the tannins, which are rich and complex. Drinkable now, with decanting, and should develop over the next six years.
Dull and uninteresting, with some simple apricot flavors and unripe vegetal notes. Acceptable for its dryness and crispness, period.
Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US

wine_name: Fire Block 2003 Old Vine Grenache (Clare Valley)
desc: Simple tart-cherry flavors finish crisp. This is on the light and lean side, but mouthwatering on the finish.

Layered, deep and opulent, this yeasty rosé sparkling wine offers warm tones of baked bread, mature peach and honey with tart accents in the form of blueberry and raspberry. The wine delivers thick creaminess in the mouth and long persistency.

Even in cooler 2007, Zull scores with this wine. It has all the right pear and apple perfumes, along with vibrant acidity and minerality. It's going to develop well over the next 4 years into a fine, elegant wine. Screwcap.

wine_name: Quinta de la Rosa 2006 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)
desc: With its attractive 500-ml package, this is a great way to present Port. The wine is perfumed, soft, full of ripe prune and chocolate flavors, with an attractive freshness.
Importer: Vinum Wine Importing and Distributing LLC

wine_name: Quinta da Alorna NV Abafado 5 Years Vinho Licoroso Fernão Pires (Tejo)
desc: Made by adding brandy to wine must, this is a sweet, liquorous wine. It has bitter orange and honey flavors that are given weight and richness by spirit and wood. It is best as an apéritif wine, chilled.

Ripe and tropical on the nose, this off-dry wine is chock-full of fleshy cantaloupe and nectarine flavors, balanced by nervy acidity and bitter tea-leaf notes. Full bodied and a tad blowsy, this finishes long on a floral note.
Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US

desc: Made with Sangiovese and a small percentage of Cabernet Sauvignon, this opens with aromas of coconut, toast and oak-driven spice. The evolved palate offers coconut, clove and ground black pepper but the fruit richness has almost dried up entirely, leaving an astringent finish.

wine_name: Marimar Torres 2000 Don Miguel Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
desc: Dark berry fruit, tea and herb accents and prominent chocolate notes feature in this multifaceted wine. It's plummy and woodsy, full in feel, yet tart and tangy on the long, rich, dark chocolate close. Drink now–2006.
Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US

desc: All fruit, this bright, candied wine is light with acidity and a soft touch of strawberry flavors. Its freshness is balanced with ripeness. Drink now.

This is a bright, crisp, nonvintage blend. While it is fruity and youthful in character, the blend's older vintages also make it taste mature. Pear and apple notes dominate, lacing through the tangy, zesty texture.

Stainless steel fermented, this bright, juicy PG did not go through malolactic fermentation. The crisp acids add definition and lift, the flavors a generous mix of pear, apple and tropical fruits. Tasted just a few months after harvest, it's a great wine for summer enjoyment while the young fruit flavors are in full bloom.
Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US

desc: Red fruits sing in this attractive, fruity wine made, like all the wines of this producer, from biodynamically grown grapes. The smooth texture and fresh acidity are balanced with a rounded aftertaste. This domaine wine is made to emphasize fruit and succeeds perfectly.

wine_name: Luna De Esperanza 2013 Barrel Fermented Malbec (Uco Valley)
desc: A pitch-black color, along with piercing aromas of coffee, prune and fig, announce a drawing, full-bodied palate. Dark fruit flavors come with coffee notes and lemony oak in front of an edgy finish of drying tannins. Drink through 2022.

wine_name: Two Angels 2007 Maycacamas Mountains Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
desc: Rich and fruity, a voluptuous Cab with flavors of blackberries, black currants and cocoa, with notes of raisins and a nice appliqué of toasty cedar. Good over the next few years.

wine_name: Heart & Hands 2011 Polarity Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)
desc: Polarity is an unusual golden-hued wine made from Pinot Noir grapes that have minimal skin contact after pressing. Barrel fermentation and aging, as well as substantial lees stirring lend a rich, rounded palate and abundant notes of caramel, butter and popcorn. All this lusciousness is balanced by fresh apple and lemon flavor, and brisk acidity.
Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US

desc: While zesty lime notes stand firm from start to finish, plump, white peach and tangerine flavors seem to melt into the palate of this off-dry Riesling. Lavish, yet composed, it's a showcase of ripeness maintained in balance. An irresistible sip, pour after pour.

Sharp upon entry, this has a concentration of citrus rind amid penetrating flavors of grapefruit, pineapple, orange and nectarine. The buoyant acidity keeps everything in proportion, with just a hint of bitterness at the edge of the finish.

Mature plum, scorched earth, grilled sage and a whiff of oak-driven spice aromas lead the nose. The soft, easygoing palate offers juicy black cherry, vanilla, clove and a hint of game alongside rounded tannins.

The aromas offer notes of green flower, green pepper, barrel spice, anise and cherry. There's a lovely sense of freshness and texture to the palate. Not meant to be enjoyed on its own, it will shine at the dinner table.
Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US

wine_name: Domeniile Sahateni 2014 Karakter Cabernet Sauvignon (Dealurile Munteniei)
desc: Dark garnet in the glass this Cabernet Sauvignon has aromas of blackberry, bramble and mocha. In the mouth, there are smooth tannins and flavors of cinnamon, chocolate, vanilla and black raspberry.

wine_name: Erath 2008 Knight's Gambit Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)
desc: This limited-edition Pinot Gris was barrel-fermented and aged sur lie. It broadens out the palate and adds layers of buttered popcorn, caramel and toasted hazelnuts to the apple and pear fruit flavors.
Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US

wine_name: Cantina Terlano 2003 Nova Domus Riserva White (Alto Adige)
desc: A blend of Pinot Bianco, Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc that was given more time in wood and bottle, this is a satisfying and sophisticated wine. Its thick concentration and creamy fruit nuances provide loads of pleasure.

Oak-based lactic aromas include graphite and pencil eraser notes along with heavy black fruit scents. This is big and a bit jumbled on the palate. Blackberry and black currant flavors are accompanied by pasty oak notes. On the finish, this is grabby but with cutting acidity.
Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain

desc: This wine has an unusually deep color, assertive aromas like wood smoke and cloves and very concentrated, spicy, charred flavors that don't seem to come from the grapes but probably from oak products used during aging.

wine_name: Eruption 2013 Volcano Ridge Vineyard Red (High Valley)
desc: This full-bodied wine packs a lot of punch in terms of mouthfeel and flavor. The color is extremely dark, and the flavors resemble dark chocolate, black cherries and baking spices. It is dry in style, with lip-smacking, nicely astringent tannins that counterbalance all that richness.
Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US

desc: The nose here is sweex0t-smelling and penetrating, making it reminiscent of honey, freesia flowers and lilacs. This expression of Falanghina has a lean, easy feel in the mouth with sweet almost cloying flavors on the close.

This brooding beast starts with scents of dark chocolate and coffee, then adds plenty of fruit in the form of blueberries and blackberries on the rich, chewy palate. Despite the wine's considerable heft and density of fruit, there's enough spicy complexity and a surprising degree of elegance to the long, tongue-tingling finish. Drink now–2015.
Semillon has balanced much of the aggressive grassiness of the Sauvignon Blanc, while what seems like oak also brings sweetness. The result is a fruity, nutty, creamy wine, with a long, spicy finish.

wine_name: Bryn Mawr Vineyards 2018 Innovation Series Amber Rosé (Willamette Valley)
desc: Delicate, expressive and unique, this orange wine co-ferments Pinot Gris (on the skins) with 5% Muscat. It's a bouquet of flowers with a hint of honey, and the floral character continues on through a delightful palate, anchored in juicy citrus. Winemaker Rachel Rose calls out peach gummies and loquat, but by any name the flavors are exotic, lingering and delicious.
Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US

desc: Notes of sweet quince preserves, lilac and lavender gently perfume this aromatic late-harvest Riesling. Quite voluptuous in body, with rich fruit flavor and a lush, creamy texture, it finishes long, with a hint of sweetness that's balanced by brisk white-tea astringency.
Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US

wine_name: Foxen 2010 7200 Grassini Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
desc: Lots of ripe, luscious raspberry, cherry and mocha fruit in this Cabernet. It has good acidity and some fine tannins. One drawback is the finish, which is rich in brown sugar and glycerine, with high alcohol. Drink up.
Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US

desc: Light scents of rose petals and rose soap introduce this elegant Gewurztraminer. Clean and tasting a bit tart, this would make an excellent aperitif, lightly chilled.
Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US

desc: Here's a well-toasted red wine from Southern Italy that sees eight months of oak for added aromas of spice and tobacco. It has a sophisticated edge and loads of fresh fruit nuances at the core.
Here's an earthy wine that opens with aromas of tilled earth, ripe berry and game. The palate offers black cherry, ripe raspberry, plum, fig and coffee, with a note of bitter nut on the finish.
Appellation: Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio, Southern Italy, Italy

desc: This is a beautifully aged Collector's Edition of Taurasi made to celebrate Mastroberardino's 130th anniversary as an exporter of wine to Europe and America. Elegant and aristocratic, the wine delivers fine notes of resin, molasses, black licorice, prune and plum cake. The intensity of flavors is remarkable and the wine has thick, impenetrable density and solid tannins.

wine_name: Zepaltas 2013 Suacci Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
desc: An ethereally lithe and elegant wine, the aromatic profile and exuberance on the palate suggest savory and spicy specks of pomegranate, cranberry and even rhubarb. It's fresh, structured and well-integrated, with a bite of bark and clove on the rounded finish.

wine_name: Bründlmayer NV Brut Reserve Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)
desc: Notes of Golden Delicious apple and rye bread crumb on the nose signal both freshness and autolytic richness. The palate then portrays salty, buttery short crust, still imbued with that apple freshness, set against yeasty texture and depth, pervaded by lemon freshness and enlivened by creamy, fine, salty foam. Gorgeous balance, wonderful freshness, great elegance. Bravo.

Scents of perfumed berry, eucalyptus, chopped herb and a whiff of leather unfold in the glass. The smooth, delicious palate doles out juicy black cherry, crushed raspberry, freshly ground black pepper and anise alongside polished, velvety tannins.
Appellation: Carignano del Sulcis, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy

wine_name: Henri Goutorbe 2005 Spécial Club Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)
desc: Goutorbe is a member of the Spécial Club grouping of grower producers, which tastes and approves each other's special cuvée. This 2005, with its ripe fruits and the beginnings of bottle age, is a worthy member. It has delicious apple and white peach fruits, lively acidity and a texture that is moving towards toastiness. The wine is ready to drink.

wine_name: Patit Creek Cellars 2009 Sagemoor Vineyards Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))
desc: Give this wine some airing out to let the SO2 blow off, and it will reward you with a pleasant mix of orange peel, sweet citrus and honeydew fruit. The residual sugar is 1.35%, but it feels a bit sugary in the mouth—definitely in the off-dry camp. Some of the fruit is from a 1973 Sagemoor block, among the oldest Riesling in Washington.
Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US

desc: Displays distinct valley-floor qualities, with its well-ripened black-currant fruit and soft, intricately woven tannins. Feels rich and lush in the mouth, and coats the palate through the long finish. Oak provides a context, but doesn't overwhelm. Feels too soft to age, but you never know. —S.H.

Shows more delicacy than many 2003s, with flowery, green fruit aromas and a light, ethereal mouthfeel. Pear and melon flavors are easy to enjoy now, finishing soft. Imported by Valckenberg International, Inc.
Ripe, tropical flavors of pear, peach and banana mingle in this blend of five vineyards. It's fleshy and ripe.

wine_name: Carson Ridge 2018 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles Estrella District)
desc: Dried flowers, taut berries and crushed stone show on the nose of this reserve bottling. Elegantly chiseled tannins frame the sip, delivering ripe flavors of blackberry and plum with underlying hints of dried purple flowers.
Appellation: Paso Robles Estrella District, Central Coast, California, US

wine_name: Acorn 2006 Alegría Vineyard Heritage Vines Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
desc: Rich and savory, with jammy-sweet, briary blackberry, cherry, currant, mocha, tabasco and dusty spice flavors that are intricate and complex. It's a strong, direct wine, yet has Zin's classic appeal.
Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US

desc: Truffle, espresso, hazelnut and blue flower aromas emerge from the glass along with whiffs of toasted oak. On the elegantly structured palate, fine-grained tannins support red cherry, blood orange, star anise and a hint of espresso. Bright acidity keeps it balanced. Drink through 2026.

It's not so much the fruit but the richness and concentration that mark this wine. Yet it's not superripe because of the hot 2003 vintage. This wine, with its origins in biodynamically grown grapes, preserves a great purity of fruit as it layers intense almond and citrus flavors over vanilla and yellow fruit tastes. It should age well.

wine_name: Les Caves Roties de Pente 2006 Syrah (Dry Creek Valley)
desc: A bit brawny, with sweet, pie-filling flavors of blackberries and cherries, sprinkled with cocoa, cinnamon and pepper, like a Starbucks drink. Shows the rich tannins and briary notes of a Dry Creek Valley red.
Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US

desc: Bone dry and nicely crisp, and the price is right, but the wine itself has some problems. The fruits tend toward lean, tart grapefruits, lemons and limes, with a touch of vegetable.

wine_name: Ancient Peaks 2009 Oyster Ridge Red (Paso Robles)
desc: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah, Petit Verdot and Malbec, this is bone dry and full bodied, and it strikes the palate with rustic tannins. It has a complexity that's hard to define, and it will pair well with grilled meats or stews.
Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US

wine_name: Château Cantinot 2009 Haut Boutet de Château Cantinot  (Premieres Côtes de Blaye)
desc: Fruity and earthy, this is a spice- and black currant-filled wine. With Malbec in the blend, it has distinct tannins that give shape to the juicy fruit.
Appellation: Premieres Côtes de Blaye, Bordeaux, France

wine_name: Greg Norman Estates 2016 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
desc: With the assistance of winemaker Margo Van Staaveren, the golfer offers a 100% varietal wine that's soft and supple in appeal. Red fruit and light spice, chocolate and cedar notes accent a rich full-bodied character that's dense, dark and brooding.

wine_name: Symington Family Estates 2015 Quinta do Ataíde Red (Douro)
desc: The extensive organic vineyard of Quinta do Ataíde is in the Douro Superior. This wine, made from selected parcels of vines, is full, spicy with hints of the wood aging, along with mint aromas. Its richness and its dense texture are lightened by acidity. It will still need to age further, so drink from 2020.

wine_name: Adams Bench 2012 Red Willow Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)
desc: Aromatically brooding, this wine slowly opens to reveal notes of scorched earth, incense, cassis, herbs and flowers. It coats the palate with layer upon layer of cherry and plum flavors supported by chewy tannins. The finish lingers. It will be best after 2020.
Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US

wine_name: Mommessin 2001 Les Champs Gain Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)
desc: Lavishly oaked, with toast and smoke dominating hints of peaches and vanilla on the nose. Turns lemony on the palate, which is big and bulky, yet very tart and smoky on the finish. Young and disjointed right now.

wine_name: Tamber Bey 2006 Deux Chevaux Vineyard Chardonnay (Yountville)
desc: Sweet new oak and jammy tropical fruit co-star in this Chard, offering immediate gratification but little complexity or follow-through. Needs a defter, more sensitive hand, especially at this price.

This rustic Cab offers green spicy pepper and smoke on the nose, with flavors of green pepper, smoke and blackberries on the palate. Sturdy tannins and some cedary, woody complexity give it extra character. A unique find that speaks of its terroir.

wine_name: Chronicle 2009 Savoy Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
desc: The grapes obviously were well grown, as this wine shows a particular intensity of red cherry fruit, as well as minerality. The acidity is just about perfect, the tannins brisk and fine. Yet it's too young to offer full enjoyment. Cellar this polished Pinot Noir for 4–6 years to let it change in interesting ways.
Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US

desc: A blend of Carricante and Catarratto from vineyards plated 600 meters above sea level on the slopes of Mount Etna, Quota 600 is among Sicily's best white wines. Compact, tonic and streamlined, it does a beautiful job of presenting delicate floral and peach fruit aromas against an austere backdrop of crushed stone and talcum powder.

This wine is shy on the nose, just revealing a brooding hint of oak and red fruit. On the palate a richness appears, overlaying the concentration of the red fruit with oak to create a dense, smooth texture. Red-cherry notes blossom slowly, breaking through the tight and graceful tannic web. Freshness shows that the fruit was captured at a perfect juncture. Perfume, elegance and subtle power are all there.

wine_name: Fowles Wine 2016 Farm to Table Cabernet Sauvignon (Victoria)
desc: Unfortunately this wine doesn't seem to be holding up well. The color is fading and so is the nose. There are currants, raspberries, dried leaves and some floral notes, but the fruit feels a little tired and some volatility is setting in. The palate offers an appealing tang of fruit, but texturally it's lean and angular with some bitterness creeping in on the finish and heat from the alcohol.

wine_name: Sula NV Brut Tropicale Crémant de Nashik Sparkling (Nashik)
desc: Pale blush in color, with a persistent stream of small bubbles, this wine has aromas of apricot and rose petal. It offers a feeling of effervescence on the backpalate, with flavors of apple, strawberry and yellow plum that culminate on the peach-flavored finish.

Aromas of barrel spice, baking spice and earthy plum form an inviting nose. This is chewy and full on the palate, with good balance. Roasted berry, spiced plum, baking spice and clove flavors close up shop on an edgy finish, with popping acidity and residual roasted notes.

wine_name: Pierre Sparr NV Brut Réserve Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)
desc: Shows a distinctly ripe character in its warm tones of peach and brioche and a soft, creamy texture in the mouth. But there's also enough citrus and spice to provide balance and length on the finish.
This vintage of Madre features pretty aromas, inspired by fruit and flower-based elements. The wine boasts a deep ruby color and full concentration in the mouth. The finish is long and satisfying.

wine_name: Livio Felluga 2010 Friulano (Colli Orientali del Friuli)
desc: Friulano shows its best results in its native home—northeast Italy—where the wine expresses creamy richness followed by aromas of white peach, pear and honey. Pair it with shellfish or vegetable risotto.
Appellation: Colli Orientali del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy

desc: A good portion of the Chardonnay is refined in oak to render a soft and creamy sparkling wine with very good density and depth. There's a playful touch of bitter almond, honey and apricot on the close.

Heady aromas of dried cherry, fruity strawberry, light tobacco and pleasant herbs show on the nose of this bottling from Malibu. Fresh fruit flavors of roasted strawberry and plum are dusted with oregano, marjoram and pepper on the palate, which finishes on a tea-leaf kick.
Appellation: Malibu Coast, South Coast, California, US

wine_name: Montemar 2014 Rita's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
desc: Lighter in the glass, this bottling from a mountaintop vineyard shows pomegranate, sour cherry, sandalwood and roasted fennel on the nose, along with a strong mineral kick. There's a sense of crushed sandstone on the palate along with red cherries, red currants, star anise and a touch of nutmeg. It is still very fresh.
Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US

desc: A spicy wine, dry and firm in tannins, that's balanced enough to accompany food such as beef prepared with lots of spices and pepper. It shows Zin's briary, brambly profile, with wild berry and balsamic flavors, and seems best in its lusty youth.
Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US

desc: So sugary sweet, it's basically a dessert wine, and a nice one, at that. The peach and pineapple fruit flavors have a caramelized, tart-filling taste. Not really a table wine, though.
Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US

wine_name: Canoe Ridge 2017 The Expedition Chardonnay (Horse Heaven Hills)
desc: Aromas of lemon curd, butterscotch, lees and spice are followed by medium-bodied flavors that trail toward the slightly bitter finish. It's a straightforward example of the variety.
Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US

wine_name: Guicciardini Strozzi 2015 Villa Cusona  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)
desc: This has heady floral aromas of honeysuckle and orange blossom. The palate is medium-bodied and round, delivering yellow apple, citrus zest and candied ginger notes, framed by bright acidity.
Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy

wine_name: Maior de Mendoza 2013 Sobre Lías Albariño (Rías Baixas)
desc: This fresh wine opens with a pleasant blend of melon, citrus, white-flower and mineral aromas. The palate is similar to the bouquet: citrusy and minerally. Flavors of tangerine, orange and nectarine are tangy and bright, while the finish is citrusy and scouring.

This wine spent time in French, American and Hungarian oak, 25% of it new. It offers a classically herbal expression of the variety, exhibiting notes of black olive and leather over fruity tones. Tight and grippy, it needs to open over time to let the aromas catch up on the palate.

Atypical, proprietary aromas of blowsy tropical fruits, apple cider, white rose and lettuce are perplexing. The palate, with its depth and balance, suggests high quality, while flavors of lime, sweet lettuce and green herbs finish calm, with complexity and richness.

Slightly herbal and peppery, backed by tart cherry-berry flavors and hints of vanilla and chocolate. Supple, without much apparent tannin, but built instead around crisp acids. Turns slightly cranberryish on the finish, simultaneously picking up a luscious hint of hickory smoke.
Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US

desc: Rich, mountainous yet velvety, this affordable Cab offers boysenberry, blackberry and green pepper, and a whiff of baked bread. Perfect for filling people's glasses up at a party.

An inaugural release, this is made from specific blocks grown in Knights Valley and Alexander Valley as well as from the high-elevation Cooley Ranch. Leathery and tannic, it coils in youthful aggression, just barely allowing for a taste of blackberry jam and chocolate.

Mountain-like tannins make for a robust, powerful and concentrated palate that shows a leathery texture. Sage, black pepper and black currant spice up richer elements of dark chocolate and caramelized oak.

wine_name: Smith & Hook 2010 Westside Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
desc: There are very savory aromas on this wine, with campfire smoke and herb-crusted game dominating the boysenberry fruit in the background. The tannins are edgy, and toasted oak flavors persist in a pleasant way, with black cherry and licorice present as well.
Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US

desc: Powdery white-fruit aromas come with hints of spiced apple and citrus. This is fruity and chunky on the palate, with apple and peach flavors boosted by strong acidity. On the finish, citrus flavors are dominant.

wine_name: Criss Cross 2016 Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Clarksburg)
desc: Oak spiciness lights up the bouquet and flavors of this full-bodied firmly tannic wine. It's not as heavy in alcohol as some, but is very rich in flavors of black plums and blackberries, black pepper and light oak char, and has a good, grippy texture.

wine_name: Château Terrasson 2013 Cuvée Prevenche  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
desc: This old-vine wine shows signs of rotten fruit, certainly aromatically. On the palate, it is tight with dark tannins and a hard, extracted edge. It is hard to tell if it could soften. This property liess in both the Castillon and Franc appellations. Wine is vinified plot by plot.
Appellation: Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France

wine_name: Cono Sur 2005 Visión Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
desc: A nicely made Chilean Cabernet that delivers ripe, toasty fruit-based aromas in front of tasty cassis and blackberry flavors. As for mouthfeel, it's full and layered as it pours on the toast and vanilla shadings. Simply stated, it's a clean, easy, fresh red wine with a bit of character.

Toasted nut, rhubarb, pepper and spice box aromas abound on the nose of this plucky red. Black cherry, spice and pepper flavors follow. Clean, spicy and food friendly, this selection is ageable and assertive.

wine_name: Macari 2010 Block E White (North Fork of Long Island)
desc: Streaks of sweet cream and caramel accent delicate peach and apricot tones in this Chardonnay-dominant ice-style wine. Plush and yielding, it may come off a bit confected, but it's appealing nonetheless.
Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US

desc: Plays it right down the middle. A good quality Cab at a fair price. Shows a rich tannic-acid structure and ripe fruit that has an earthy mushroom and soy edge. Drinking well now and for the next several years.
An obtuse nose is stale and vaguely melony. On the palate, this is chunky and unfit. Papaya and vanilla flavors are passable and sugary, nothing more.

wine_name: Château Thivin 2016 Clos de Rochebonne  (Beaujolais Blanc)
desc: Produced from organically grown grapes, this ripe, smoothly fruity wine has a light toast flavor from the wood aging. With its balance between citrus acidity and ripe yellow fruits, the wine is both rich and crisply textured. Drink now.

wine_name: Domaine du Petit Clocher 2018 Chenin Blanc (Anjou)
desc: This intense, full-bodied wine is full of baked-apple and cooked-pear flavors. There is certainly acidity here, but it is integrated in the wine's ripeness and weight. The perfumed, nutty aftertaste is as full as the rest of this rich wine.

wine_name: D'Arenberg 2008 The Feral Fox Pinot Noir (Adelaide)
desc: This taut, tangy Pinot Noir displays plenty of intensity but lacks any sense of elegance. Maraschino cherries lead the way, ending up a bit rough and warm on the finish.

Soft and lush in blackberry-infused chocolate, cherry, licorice and roasted oak flavors, with a hint of red currants, this Cab is, in a word, delicious. It represents how fine Paso Robles Cabernet can be in the right hands.
Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US

wine_name: Domaine Luquet NV Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)
desc: This is a ripe, fruity, creamy Chardonnay-based sparkler. It has a tropical fruit flavor, with some sweetness from both the fruit and the high dosage. It's in a full-bodied, attractive apéritif style.

wine_name: Merry Edwards 2007 Meredith Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
desc: A splendid, near-perfect Pinot, although it's very young and will benefit from time in the bottle. Few Pinots offer richer, more massive flavors. Just explodes on the palate with raspberries, cherries, persimmons, Dr. Pepper cola, mocha and cinnamon spices, yet the tannin-acid structure keeps it all balanced. A joy to drink as it warms and changes in the glass. Now–2014.
Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US

desc: The nose smells washed out, with hazy notes of char and cassis that come with a touch of sulfur. Light to medium bodied, the palate feels slick, soft and sweet tasting, with a candied cherry note that appears on the finish.

A nose with mild citrus and banana aromas is indicative of the fleshy but basic wine that follows. Dry flavors of peach pit are slightly bitter, and it's dull on the finish. This wine marks Cuatro Rayas's 40th year.
Not the best showcase for Mendocino fruit, this inexpensive, high-production Merlot is tight and one-dimensional with not a lot of fruitiness and a slight bitterness on the finish.
Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US

desc: This perfumed wine is ripe and packed with red fruits. Its soft texture, generous fruits and acidity are balanced to give a smooth, rich wine that will be ready to drink in 2018.

Starting out brooding, this wine offers notes of incense, vanilla, char and dark fruit, showing a touch of oxygen exposure. The palate is chock-full of cherry flavors supported by lightly grainy tannins.
Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US

wine_name: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2015 Montiggl Riesling (Alto Adige)
desc: This opens with heady aromas of jasmine, lemon zest and apricot while the lively palate offers green apple, white peach, citrus and a whiff of flint. Crisp acidity leaves a refreshing finish.

wine_name: Spy Valley 2016 Envoy Johnson Vineyard Waihopai Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
desc: This vintage of Spy Valley's top wine is very reductive at the moment, with intense oniony aromas overpowering all the rest. It struggles to blow off with exposure to air but eventually does eke out soft citrus, flint and toasty oak (a “Fumé Blanc” style, it spends 12 months in oak). The palate sears with laser-sharp acidity that slices through a creamy, opulent mouthfeel and juicy citrus fruit. The oak can be felt right through to the finish.

wine_name: Sevtap 2016 Cabernet Franc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
desc: Extracted aromas of black plum and pepper spices show on the nose of this bottling. Dark red cherries, oak smoke, baking spice and cracked pepper show on the cohesive palate.
Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US

desc: Seductively earthy yet dazzling with red cherry and raspberry flavors, this full-bodied but freshly concentrated Trollinger is among the best you'll find in the United States. It's a smoky, gorgeously perfumed red that's drinks best with a slight chill. Tasted in 2020, it's still surprisingly fresh. Enjoy now–2025.
This gets the job done with direct cherry, chocolate and root beer flavors and a veneer of smoky oak. Finishing soft and a little sweet, this Merlot straddles the line between everyday and fancy.

wine_name: Travaglino 2010 Riserva del Fondatore Vincenzo Comi Sparkling (Oltrepò Pavese)
desc: Pressed wildflower, ripe white stone fruit and whiffs of baked bread take shape in the glass. The creamy, ethereal palate offers ripe Rennet apple, white cherry, orange rind and a hint of toasted hazelnut alongside bright acidity and a silky mousse. A ginger note lingers on the finish.

After an initial clarified butter aroma invites one in, this fleshy, full-bodied white is smooth and delicate, taking on body and weight as it develops in the glass. Anise, green apple and pineapple flavors meet a coterie of toasted oak and smoke.
Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US

desc: The perfume develops slowly before blossoming into an enticingly exotic, bergamot-flavored wine. Acidity keeps it fresh but it does end up with a slighty confectionery finish. Glass stopper.

This late harvest wine from Hungary is comprised of Furmint, Hárslevelu and Muscat. It has aromas of acacia flower and pear, with flavors of apricot, pear juice and dried rosemary. The finish is pleasantly sweet without being too cloying.

wine_name: Marchesi Antinori NV Cuvée Royale Nature Brut Sparkling (Italy)
desc: This Cuvée Royale delivers candy-like notes of sweet honeysuckle and butterscotch. It is a luminous and fresh wine with a clean and simple mouthfeel backed a touch of tangy spice that is driven by the wine's tonic effervescence.

On the nose, nuts and caramel dominate, but in the mouth enough stone fruits emerge to bring to mind peaches and cherries drizzled with the liquid nuts from the ice cream parlor. It's elegant--almost delicate--bringing complexity and flavor without heaviness, and it ends on a lingering smoky, coffee-like note.

Earthy and brawny, it opens with a fragrance of stewed black fruit, Mediterranean scrub, tilled soil and a hint of toast. The warm, forward palate offers wild cherry and black raspberry accented with black pepper and a coffee note alongside round tannins. This isn't for cellaring so enjoy over the next few years.

wine_name: Ermisch 2016 Erendira's Rise Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
desc: Light and forward, this fills the mouth with texture more than rich flavor. Gentle highlights of raspberries and cherries come with a wash of chocolate malt and a streak of cola. Drink now and over the next three years.
Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US

wine_name: Thorny Rose 2011 Red Blend Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
desc: This is roughly a 50-50 blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, showing a heavy concentration of vanilla flavor, often the mark of oak alternatives during the fermentation process. Some licorice notes come through, although the fruit is rather thin and herbal—not unexpected at this price.
Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US

desc: 89-91. Barrel sample. There is a good balance here between the ripe blackberry fruits and the solid tannins. This wine shows new wood and a touch of green flavor.
This has aromas evoking cocoa, underbrush and mature black plum. The firm palate delivers prune, espresso and star anise alongside tightly wound tannins.
Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy

wine_name: J & J 2013 Estate Wine Middleton Petty Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
desc: The aromas show notes of chocolate and raspberries, sprinkled with violets and fresh herbs, not seeming to have fully blossomed. The palate is elegant and refined, displaying a lovely sense of restraint. Smoked-meat flavors linger on the finish. It doesn't always come off as entirely varietal but brings a lot of enjoyment.
Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US

desc: This is light-bodied and easy to drink while still having some heft of tannins and acidity. It smells like black cherries and toasted bread, and tastes quite fruity.

wine_name: Beckett's Flat 2004 Reserve Kosher Chardonnay (Margaret River)
desc: Offers vanilla bean, pear and herb aromas. On the palate, the wine is soft and a little sweet, with tropical fruit flavors dominating. Kosher. Imported by Abarbanel Wine Company.
The aromas pop, with notes of flower, musk, evergreen and white grapefruit zest. Off-dry drinking, creamy-feeling flavors follow, with vanilla and smoky barrel notes on the finish. It's an odd mix.
Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US

desc: Classic Nebbiolo aromas of woodland berry, forest floor, new leather and a whiff of rose lift out of the glass along with a whiff of botanical herb. Delivering elegance and structure in equal measure, the linear palate features red cherry, strawberry compote, baking spice and licorice framed in firm, polished tannins. Bright acidity keeps it well balanced. Drink 2024–2036.

wine_name: Château de Santenay 2017 Les Brunettes et Planchots  (Aloxe-Corton)
desc: This wine is structured and dense. Concentration and a touch of minerality give it considerable potential. The juicy aspect of the wine enhances the red fruits that are already so appealing. Drink the wine from 2022.

wine_name: Tim Adams 2003 The Benefit Cabernet Sauvignon (Clare Valley)
desc: This medium-sized, food-friendly Cab isn't fancy, but it has a nice rustic, earthy quality to its red berry fruit. Claylike smoothness on the palate ends with some light tea tannins. Imported by Bluewater Wine Co.
Surprisingly dry, this has richness rather than sweetness, and intense, powerful botrytis. The honey is intensely perfumed, along with baked apples and spice. Certainly a long-aging wine.

Initially this is so spritzy, it almost comes across as fizzy. The foam carries flavors of Comice pear peel, salty yeast and slightly bitter pith. This lives off texture rather than freshness and impresses with its phenolic backbone. The finish is dry and fresh.

The Fusion in question is the blend—an unusual combination of 61% Pinot Noir, 21% Syrah and 18% Merlot. Some tasters will find it works well as an everyday, all-purpose red. The jumble of red fruits is matched to a strong streak of vanilla, with some stemmy flavors coming up in the tannins.
Tar, raspberry and old wood aromas are the best part of this wine. The acidity is a little awkward, but the finish is smooth and very earthy.

Good color and quite a bit of charm. Some impressive aromas of blackberry, mocha, violets and smoky oak, and similar rich, deep flavors. The tannins are soft and inviting. It misses excellence by a hair, but it's a very good wine.
Sweet and smoky oak flavors dress up this full-bodied moderately tannic wine and there are enough good blackberry and plum flavors to balance the spiciness.
Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US

desc: Made from four Bordeaux red varieties, mostly Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, this full-bodied wine is chalky in big-boned tannin and woody oak. Green olive, sagebrush and graphite accent blackberry and black cherry, with a rounded finish.

Broad across the palate, the new vintage of Redhawk's estate bottling opens with mixed berry and watermelon flavors, and thins out quickly. The fruit is outweighed by the alcohol, which is strong enough to burn a bit in the finish.
Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US

wine_name: Carpe Diem 2000 Firepeak Vineyard Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
desc: The nose is toasted, almost roasted, and therefore fruit aromas are hard to find. But once you get to the palate there's ample cherry along with earthy, leathery accents. The finish is lively, even juicy. The acidity really shows itself late in the game, indicating that the wine could be cellared for several years.
Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US

desc: An entirely satsifying Pinot Noir that meets all the variety's basic requirements. It's dry, crisp and silky in texture, with oak-nuanced flavors of raspberries, cinnamon and mocha. Drink now in its flamboyant youth.

Earthy aromas of forest floor, tobacco leaf and leather mingle harmoniously with the black-fruit core of this Merlot-based blend, with 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, 13% Syrah and 7% Petit Verdot. The medium-weight palate boasts fruit-skin flavors of plum, cassis and berry, while accents of tobacco, balsamic herbs and pepper unfold on thelingering finish. Drink now–2016.

wine_name: Robert Mondavi 2002 Private Selection Chardonnay (Central Coast)
desc: A citrusy Chard, with mineral and sweet lime flavors that just nudge into peach and a kiss of used oak. It's clean and vibrant, and the crisp acidity will nicely complement food.
Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US

wine_name: Benovia 2014 Bella Una Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
desc: Thickly concentrated at first, this wine settles in the glass to share a wealth of juicy black-cherry flavor that's impressively accented in black tea and cola spice. Medium bodied, it feels sublime on the palate and holds its ripeness in check, allowing a simmering acidity to speak.
Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US

wine_name: Aveleda NV Casal Garcia Medium Dry Sparkling (Vinho Verde)
desc: This medium-sweet sparkling wine is soft and rounded. It has an attractive mousse, with some fresh acidity to give the sweetness a lift. The aftertaste is clean and fruity.

wine_name: Jada Vineyard & Winery 2014 Hell's Kitchen Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
desc: Fresh-pressed blackberry and strawberry meld into vanilla, milk chocolate, minty herb and gravel on the nose of this lavish blend of 57% Syrah, 33% Grenache, 7% Mourvèdre, 2% Tannat and 1% Viognier. Flavors are well rounded, with blueberry-cream sauce, dark plum, fig and touches of mint and sweet basil.
Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US

desc: Aromas suggest tilled soil and black-skinned fruit. The easygoing, simple palate presents clove, orange zest and red-skinned berry alongside rounded tannins. Drink soon.

Pepik is Chromy's entry-level Pinot; it represents a relatively affordable introduction to Tasmanian Pinot Noir. Hints of cherry blossom and fine leather add elegant grace notes to tart cherries, while the silky finish is long and crisp. Drink now.

wine_name: Tero Estates 2007 Windrow Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
desc: Fragrant and showing lots of toasty oak, this has a lifted, lightly volatile nose with pretty cherry fruit underlying it. There is a little bit of a green character to the oak, and the wine is still resolving itself. Good varietal focus and character; it opens up nicely in the glass, with pretty, ripe, round cherry/berry fruit and streaks of earth, pepper and coffee. Excellent balance into a medium finish.
Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US

desc: There's a forest-floor touch to the nose of this appellation blend that also shows smoked and raw beef, hearty berries and a slight compost touch. The mouthfeel is soft, with flavors of iron and aged beef giving nuance to the tart raspberry, pomegranate, chipped slate and dried-mint finish.
Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US

wine_name: Domaine Anderson 2017 Walraven Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
desc: Delicious, ripe fruit flavors form the core of this generous but well-balanced wine that almost bursts with raspberry, black cherry and mint character. It's technically light bodied, but very mouthfilling. Best to drink through 2025.
Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US

desc: One of New Zealand's perennial award-winners, the 2003 Mate's Chard features wonderfully complete aromas that combine scents of smoke and toasted oats with grilled fruit and nut meat. It's full-bodied, drenching the palate with grilled-nut and citrus flavors, before finishing on a long, harmonious note. Imported by Wilson Daniels Ltd.

wine_name: Flagstone 2012 The Rumor Mill Viognier (Western Cape)
desc: Soft scents of just-dried hay, yellow apple and white melon unfold with great intensity on the bright palate. Balanced and refreshing, with an attractive mango flavor on the finish. Drink now.

wine_name: Cave du Marmandais 2018 Château Campot Lafont  (Bordeaux)
desc: A ripe wine with already a balance between tannins and blackberry fruits, this is developing quickly. The touch of dryness will go over the next few months, so drink from 2021.
This usually solid producer hasn't made anything special here, this Lodi zin's aromas veering into questionable metallic areas, though on the palate the wine has some fruit.

wine_name: Wolf Blass 2003 Gold Label Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)
desc: Starts out beautifully, with grassy, sweet-pea aromas mixed in with some hay. Cleansing lemon-lime flavors in the mouth mellow out on the finish, where lemon pith lingers. Zingy half the time; understated for the remainder.

wine_name: Laetitia 2009 Les Galets Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)
desc: This offers big bursts of ripe cherry and raspberry jam, but that richness is complicated by minerality, earthiness and firm tannins, giving it true complexity. It's not very subtle, and you might think it's a Grenache if you didn't know what you were tasting, but it's certainly delicious. Drink over the next few years.
Appellation: Arroyo Grande Valley, Central Coast, California, US

wine_name: Vite Colte 2016 La Casa in Collina  (Barbaresco)
desc: Aromas of toasted hazelnut, camphor and dark-skinned berry mingle with whiffs of coconut. Tight and taut, the linear palate reflects the nose, offering espresso, dried sage, licorice and prune alongside assertive, close-grained tannins that leave a rather astringent finish.

Podere Canalino makes just over 200 cases of Brunello and offers a rustic, but genuine interpretation of the wine. There are dark, vinous aromas of black currants and red apple backed by old spice and pipe tobacco. It's slightly tart and bitter in the mouth and the tannins need a few more years to soften.

wine_name: Henri de Villamont 2015 Clos des Guettes Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)
desc: While there are wood aromas and wood flavors, the wine is equally about ripe fruit and generous tannins. It has spice, red-berry fruits and a rounded structure. It will age well, giving a rich wine from 2022.

Dark in color, a bright red plum and fresh berry wine, the fruit flavors layered over a significant toast element. The wood gives the tannin, but the wine is already coming together, offering some of the proper Volnay velvet texture.

Full plum and berry aromas are inviting and offer just a hint of oaky vanilla. A fresh palate is braced by high-energy acidity that renders this Malbec zesty in feel. A quick blast of red berry and currant flavors stays juicy and bright through the finish. Drink through 2023.

Faint orangey-brown hints at the edges indicate this classically styled wine is just starting to mature. It's tasty, with deep, pruney Nebbiolo fruit sporting tobacco and spice accents. The mouthfeel is lean and elegant, and the fruit-to-acid balance excellent. Finishes long, with good, even tannins. A very impressive normale (village wine). Drink this from 2004–2010.

This is a rich, chocolaty Cabernet with a backbone of earthy spices running along red and black berry fruit, mint and oak. The acidity is a little searing, and the alcohol shows some heat, but overall it's more medium in weight than full. Granular tannins weave together ripe fruit and spice.

Aromas of moist underbrush, saddle leather, dried herb, menthol and a whiff of game take shape in the glass. The firm palate offers raw sour cherry, cranberry, cinnamon and a hint of tobacco while close-grained tannins provide the framework and leave an astringent finish. Give the tannins a few more years to unwind then drink.

No one gives Gewürz much respect, but it is really lovely when done well, as it is here. Fragrant, complex, and rich with lush fruits and interesting accents, this is quite dry, hence food-friendly, and has a resonant, persistent finish.
Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US

desc: Powerful and dark in color, with perfumed fruits, laden with tannins and sweet damsons, licorice and coffee. The acidity cuts through, bringing a fine edge to this rich and concentrated wine.

Lots of spicy oak meets very ripe, jammy fruit flavors in this medium- to full-bodied wine, as mild tannins add a bit of structure. It is oaky for sure, but not as extreme as some in this price range.

wine_name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2002 Mambourg Grand Cru White (Alsace)
desc: A blend of Pinot Gris, Pinot Noir, Pinot Meunier and Pinot Blanc, this wine poses omething of a challenge to the reviewer. The aromas are slightly oxidative, the alcohol levels elevated and yet the wine lacks lushness to balance it's large frame. Instead, hard, crystalline flavors power the palate, leaving the impression of a multifaceted rock. Seems to have stuff worthy of more introspection and intellectual curiosity than our blind-tasting format allows; not a hedonistic bomb by any measure.

Earthy, slightly mushroomy aromas of pine needle and forest floor are layered across the black-raspberry fruit on the nose of this bottling. The palate is a bit more oaky, with cocoa, red cherry, licorice and a touch more pine.
Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US

desc: Crisp, well-defined fruit is counterbalanced by vanilla and spice to form a vibrant, pleasing wine. This Brunello delivers chewy tannins and a plush mouthfeel that lasts a long time. Pair it with lamb or succulent cuts of grilled meat.

Dusty earth, leather and tobacco notes juxtapose rich, luscious blackberry and plum in this bold, big-bodied wine. Intensely fruit forward but also balanced and complex, it finishes on a seductively dark mineral tone.
Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US

desc: This ripe, fruity blended Cab is bursting with cassis, mocha and smoky oak flavors. The tannins are very smooth and ripe. A minor quibble is the alcoholic heat throughout.

The scents of this wine speak indubitably of its place, running the gamut of classic descriptors from apple and lime to honey and slate. It's dry and lithe on the palate, combining citrus and crushed-stone flavors, and finishing crisp and clean.

wine_name: Casa Silva 2012 Microterroir de Los Lingues Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)
desc: Casa Silva makes some of the most varietal Carmenère in Chile, and this special selection is even more loaded with cola, eucalyptus and minty blackberry aromas than other wines from Los Lingues. A pinched palate is tight and clipped despite this being a mature 2012. Burnt oak, burnt coffee and herbal black fruit flavors finish with peppery spice, clove and the inherent green essence always shown by wines from this property.

wine_name: José Maria da Fonseca 2013 Domini Red (Douro)
desc: This is a tight and structured wine, showing a fine balance between tannin and acidity, with dark, brooding fruit that still need time to develop. Give this wine until 2018.

wine_name: Sevtap 2013 Bosphorus Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
desc: The nose is a bit curious, with hard vanilla, smoked melon and grilled citrus. Smoke carries to the palate, with charred applewood most prominent, making for an atypical but somewhat enjoyable Sauv Blanc.
Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US

desc: This is a lovely example of top-tier Oregon Chardonnay, with ripe apple, melon and Meyer lemon fruit entwined and framed in lively acidity and toasty oak. The balance, depth and overall deliciousness all factor in to the rating, and the wine is just entering a prime drinking window.
Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US

desc: Dry, dark and full bodied, this big red wine supports blackberry and black-cherry flavors on a firm structure of moderate tannins. The grippy mouthfeel needs a juicy protein dish to pair with.
Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US

wine_name: Tenuta La Marchesa 2011 Gold Label Red (Monferrato)
desc: The 2011 Gold Label Monferrato Rosso offers delicious ripe fruit and spice. It's loaded with blackberry, raspberry, black pepper and licorice flavors all presented in an easy-drinking but enormously enjoyable style. This will pair with virtually anything and everything.
The winery turns to this Monterey appellation to up their Chardonnay games. The wine is lush and oaky, with intensely ripe tangerine and apricot flavors.
Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US

desc: Enticing floral aromas of fragrant blue flower and rose mingle with wild berry and camphor. On the elegant, focused palate, fresh acidity and taut, polished tannins accompany juicy Morello cherry, crushed raspberry, cinnamon and star anise. Drink 2021–2027.

Semillon is an excellent food wine and this vibrant selection from South Africa will pair beautifully with everything from lobster salad to a Moroccan chicken tagine. Playful citrus flavors mingled with honey give the wine weight as well as life, while the dryness and acidity on the palate leave a clean finish. A versatile wine with character.
This medium-bodied wine is quite dry, offering a prosciutto aroma and white-pepper flavors. It's an unusual style of rosé that has a serious, savory appeal.
Fruity and lush, this Sauvignon offers a blast of lemon and lime, pineapple, apple sauce and cinnamon spice flavors, offset by crisp acids. With no oak, the fruit is the real star.

wine_name: St. Urbans-Hof 2012 Ockfener Bockstein Erste Lage Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
desc: Whiffs of pollen, saffron and spring ramps lend a savory tone to this semi-sweet Riesling. Waxy orange-peel and tangerine flavors brighten the palate, along with a nervy streak of lemon-lime acidity on the finish.

wine_name: Josef Jamek 2018 Ried Klaus Smaragd Riesling (Wachau)
desc: Juicy, ripe peach is gilded with ripe Mandarin orange fruit and zestiness on the expressive, inviting nose. The palate is juicy and marked by that ripe Mandarin juiciness that adds as much fruit as it does gentle freshness and the aromatic, pithy, texture of citrus peel. There is concentration, direction and utter, delirious citrus juiciness. The finish is dry, aromatic and zesty. Drink now–2040.

wine_name: Hungerford Hill 2009 Fishcage Shiraz (New South Wales)
desc: Hungerford Hill's vast array of wines includes this savory Shiraz, which features ample leather, tar, black olive and coffee flavors. It's fleshy and supple on the palate, with softly lingering tannins on the finish. Drink now–2017.
Appellation: New South Wales, New South Wales, Australia

desc: A wine of architectural strength and classical proportions, this has straight lines that mark the packed, concentrated fruits, which are sustained by its tannins. This is certainly the best wine that Léoville-Poyferré has produced, sumptuous while so finely structured.
This wine is now mature, a beautiful transformation into ripe almond, melon and yellow-fruit flavors with an intense tang of ripe citrus. It is perfectly ready to drink.

wine_name: Loberger NV Brut Extra Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)
desc: A hint of freshness on the nose of this wine stops just sort of full citrus flavors. The palate is creamy and fresh, with an edge of phenolic structure and subtle notions of apple flesh. It finishes very dry.

wine_name: Séamus Wines 2015 Buena Tierra Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
desc: This is a full-bodied white rich in buttery oak and baked apple, with a tang of lemon and a yeasty nose of baked biscuit.
Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US

wine_name: Scott Family 2014 Dijon Clone Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
desc: Cranberry fruit and hibiscus lead the nose of this bottling, bolstered by wild thyme and fennel scents. There is a pleasant sandalwood entry to the palate, where a rounded, smoky quality enwraps the tart raspberry fruit.
Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US

desc: Deliciously perfumed wine, full of the ripest fruit along with smoky tannins. It revels in the bright fruit flavors that add to the pleasure. This is a wine that will develop relatively quickly, although it will age as well.

A pleasant, citrusy Chardonnay, but one that is well-oaked, with the resulting aromas and flavors of vanilla and buttered toast. Lemon and lime flavors veer into riper peach, and are wrapped in a creamy texture. Acidity is quite high and bursts on the palate with a mouthwatering zest.

wine_name: Franco Conterno NV Metodo Classico Punta Extra Brut Nebbiolo (Vino Spumante)
desc: The nose is rather shy but eventually yields suggestions of yellow stone fruit, bread crust and a whiff of grilled herb. The aromas carry over to the vibrant palate along with cedar and orange zest. A bitter almond note marks the close.

wine_name: Poggio al Chiuso 2013 Le Cappelle Red (Toscana)
desc: Made with 80% Sangiovese and 20% Merlot, this opens with subdued aromas suggesting red plum and baking spice. The aromas carry on to the straightforward palate, together with a hint of hazelnut. It's easy drinking, with fresh acidity and round tannins.

This lively, fruity wine has soft apple flavors and refreshing acidity. A zesty backdrop to the fruitiness gives a light texture. The wine, which comes from one of the cooler regions of Alentejo, is ready to drink.

This tastes complex, mellow and delicious, showing diverse aroma nuances like bay leaf and forest floor in addition to more fruity, black cherry, cinnamon and clove notes. It is full bodied, very ripe and juicy, and feels smooth in texture thanks to subdued acidity and tannins.

wine_name: Schloss Reinhartshausen 2006 Erbach Marcobrunn Edition Marianne Erstes Gewächs Riesling (Rheingau)
desc: Smoky, slaty and oily, this is a mineral-driven, “terroir” wine, without obvious fruit notes, yet not lacking for fruit, if that makes any sense. It's medium-bodied, with just a touch of apparent sugar, and finishes long, with just a touch of citrus.
Designation: Erbach Marcobrunn Edition Marianne Erstes Gewächs

desc: As it should be, this wine is riper-tasting than Selbach-Oster's one-star spätlese, but not any better from a qualitative perspective. It shows more yellow plum aromatics and features a lush mouthfeel that partially masks a steel backbone of acidity. Expect this to close down for a few years before blossoming around age eight. —J.C.

wine_name: Domaine Vincent Carême 2016 Tania & Vincent Carême Spring  (Vouvray)
desc: This wine is yeasty and fruity, with good aging potential. Nuttiness, spice and a touch of ginger give this wine a fruity character that is still developing. Good acidity and a crisp floral aftertaste point to the future. Drink from 2020.

After Chardonnay, Torrontés is Argentina's other white. This one is light and semisweet, with nice acids, a pretty floral bouquet and simple but clean melon, kiwi and lychee flavors. Once the white grape of 16th-century Spanish missionaries, Torrontés has adapted well to Argentina, just about the only place it's grown these days.

Here's a compact and clean Sangiovese from Tuscany with measured aromas of black fruit, forest floor and exotic spice. The intensity of the wine is not very high, but it does offer smooth tannins and natural freshness that would pair well with easy pork or veal dishes.

wine_name: Le Vigne 2014 Di Ranchita Vista Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
desc: Strong aromas of blueberries and blue flowers show on this rich and penetrating wine from the eastside of Paso Robles. Thick and chalky tannins coat the palate, delivering more blueberry and ripe grape flavors, cut by a strong acidity.
Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US

wine_name: Buttonwood Grove 2017 Reserve Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)
desc: Aromas of charred berries, smoke and coffee are prominent on the nose and lead to the oak-laden palate. Texturally speaking, this is quite pleasing in its soft tannins frame and gently rounded palate.
Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US

wine_name: Mount Eden Vineyards 2012 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
desc: Seared yellow grapefruit, white flowers and a hint of almonds make for a fresh but simultaneously nutty nose on this classic bottling from the historic producer, whose grapes come from the top of the high-elevation appellation. The extremely energized palate is enlivened by flavors of salted lemons, a buttery warmth and racy yet rich minerality, from chalk and slate to graphite and flint.
Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US

desc: Full-force blackberry, cherry, and licorice create a lovely bouquet, which is followed nicely by cherry, plum, and additional berry flavors. The finish is broad, meaty and firm, with fine tannins.

Lots of orange, mango, vanilla cream, buttered toast and cinnamon spice flavors characterize this Chardonnay, which uses grapes that are sourced mostly from the Arroyo Seco region. It tastes candied, but refreshing acidity and a keen minerality lift it above the ordinary.

This pink blend of half Grenache and half Gamay Noir starts with a slightly sour nose of raspberry and lemon rind. There is great grip to the palate, which is shy in flavors but allows wet stone, nectarine flesh and citrus pith to cut through the acid and texture.
Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US

wine_name: De Loach 2017 Forgotten Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
desc: Made from vines planted pre-Prohibition, this wine is thick in tannin and jammy in high-toned red-berry fruit. Dust, cinnamon, nutmeg and oak play along the midpalate of weighted concentration and intensity, finishing with a trace of black pepper.

Comes on solid and strong with smoky aromas of black fruit, coconut and shoe polish. Stout and layered in the mouth, with full tannins and a nice mix of bold berry flavors, tobacco, herbs, spice and lemony oak. Tastes similar on the finish, with tobacco and spice lasting the longest. Complex and healthy; drink now through 2018.
Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain

wine_name: Hard Six Cellars 2014 Seven Pillars Syrah (Fort Ross-Seaview)
desc: From a new, small producer, this vibrantly peppery wine captures the power and grace the variety is capable of when grown on the far reaches of the coast. That peppery quality follows through on the palate, buoyed by juicy acidity and smoothly layered blackberry, tobacco and tea flavors. Exquisitely made and worth seeking out.

A salmon-pink color in the glass, this opens with scents of bruised peach, melon and strawberry that follow through to the medium-weight palate alongside brighter notes of pineapple core and grapefruit peel. Medium acidity helps to keep the palate lifted and the finish bright. Drink now.

wine_name: Telmo Rodríguez 2004 M2 de Matallana  (Ribera del Duero)
desc: Expect no shortage of power and pounding tannins from this modern-styled, heavily extracted Tempranillo. The nose is dark, sweet and jammy, but all pleasantries cease there; the palate is tannic as nails, with baked plum and other roasted dark-fruit flavors. To this taster, it's a hard, tough wine. Others may find it more appealing.
Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain

desc: Thick, raisiny berry aromas come with notes of licorice, mineral and black peppercorn. Feels tight and juicy, with zesty red fruit flavors, sweet black fruit flavors and shadings of schisty minerality and licorice. Smooth and sturdy on the finish.
Oak and roasted coffee bean aromas carry over to the lean palate along with a note of dark spice. Astringent tannins grip the assertive finish.

wine_name: Le Salette 2010 Pergole Vece Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)
desc: Black plum, blue flower, oak, espresso and chocolate aromas waft from the glass of this densely structured wine. The palate delivers blueberry extract, roasted coffee bean, vanilla and spice alonside tightly packed wood tannins that generate an astringent, mouth-drying finish. Give it time to unwind. Drink 2018–2030.
Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy

desc: Ripe and fruity, the 2009 echoes the flavors of the previous vintage, bringing in suggestions of pear, pineapple, green banana and papaya. It's all wrapped in a bit of alcoholic heat, but not so much as to detract from the rich fruit flavors. A solid base of acid and skin tannins gives the wine the support it needs.
Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US

wine_name: William Hill Estate 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
desc: Hard and tough in tannins now, with a dry astringency. It's a good, balanced Cabernet, with very rich blackberry, currant and chocolate flavors, but those gritty tannins are difficult. Give it a few years in the cellar.

wine_name: Trenel Fils 2011 Hommage à André Trénel  (Saint-Véran)
desc: This is a rich and smooth wine, creamy and full of baked apple and ripe pear flavors. Rounded with warm flavors, it carries just the right amount of citrus acidity and a touch of toast. Drink now until 2018.

An old favorite from Eberle, this release is fragrant with orangey butter, smoky honeysuckle and vanilla aromas that lead to impressively ripe tangerine and vanilla flavors. It's frankly sweet, with good balancing acidity.
Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US

desc: This is a pretty, delicate wine with notes of honey, blossoms, peaches and lychees and tomato leaf. There's a lovely chalky texture, with mouthwatering acidity and a ripe fruit character adding to the wine's charm.

Aromas of red berry, tilled soil, violet and dark spice mingle with a hint of underbrush. On the lithe, linear palate, a mineral note evoking rusted iron accents mature wild cherry and star anise while dusty tannins provide support. Acquired in 2018 by Fontanafredda, which has invested in the vineyards and the cellars, this is an estate to watch.

90–92. Barrel Sample. This is one of the large number of small estates in west Saint-Emilion's important Figeac neighborhood. The wine is dense yet juicy, with black fruit flavors and layers of attractive acidity. Drink from 2024.

This zesty red has pretty aromas that suggest small red berry, blue flower and a whiff of moist soil. The vibrant palate offers sour cherry, pomegranate and a hint of anise alongside zesty acidity and refined tannins.

wine_name: Edi Simcic 2006 Duet Lex Red (Goriska Brda)
desc: Lifted blackberry and cherry aromas meld into flavors of ripe black-fruit, violet and black pepper on this bold, beautiful Bordeaux-style blend. It's richly concentrated, with vibrant acidity and lush, furry tannins. Generously spiced on the finish.
This will satisfy your Chardonnay sweet tooth with its flavors of orange and apricot jam, pineapple and vanilla-cream. It's pretty basic, but benefits from crisp acidity.

Napa and Sonoma fruit shares the spotlight with Lodi grapes to produce this soft, simple wine. Filled with summery, appley sweetness, it's spicy-peppery clean, with a honeyed finish that tastes like vanilla custard.
A steely, crisp and linear expression of the variety that's soft and approachable, this offers ripe apple and fig at its core, around a medium body and finish.

wine_name: Château de Pizay 2011 Rosé d'Une Nuit Gamay (Beaujolais Rosé)
desc: This tastes bone dry, with a caramel note that's followed by light, bright notes of red berry and apple. The finish is crisp and tight.

wine_name: Hidden Ridge 2012 55% Slope Impassable Mountain Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
desc: This robustly generous wine is impactful in chocolate and sweet, soft plum. A complexity of cedar, herb and blackberry marks the palate, with integrated tannins and oak. The complementary elements provide intrigue and flavor in a heavyweight package, ready for cellaring through 2022.

This is a sort of second tier wine from Talbott. It's a strongly flavored Chardonnay and extremely ripe, with pineapple jam, apricot-infused crème brûlée and sweet vanilla-butterscotch flavors. But for all the richness, it's crisp and bone dry. Easy to find, with 20,000 cases.
Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US

wine_name: Pierre Henri Morel 2010 Laudun Blanc White (Côtes du Rhône Villages)
desc: Pierre Henri Morel is Chapoutier's general manager, but he also has his own line of wines that can often represent excellent value. This blend of Grenache, Clairette and Bourboulenc is full bodied and rich, toasty and smoky with oak influence and well endowed with peach and pineapple fruit. Drink it over the next year.
Appellation: Côtes du Rhône Villages, Rhône Valley, France

wine_name: Novy 2003 Garys' Vineyard Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)
desc: Supple and full-bodied, thanks to admirable fruit extract and high alcohol (15.2%). Supporters lauded its rich mouthfeel and coffee and grilled meat flavors, while detractors lamented its hot finish.
Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
