wine_name: Duca di Salaparuta 2001 Colomba Platino White (Sicilia)
desc: Mild toast aromas add a modern touch to this plump, viscous white that's built around a core of pear and lemon flavors. Seems as if it would be a good companion to oily Mediterranean fish dishes.

wine_name: Merriam 2014 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
desc: This wine is somewhat dull in texture and elusive in fruit, offering a strong sense of oak and sulfur.
Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US

desc: Last year's bottling was a hard act to follow, but Mauritson's done it again. The vintage was cooler and this wine seems crisper and zestier but no less flavorful, bursting at the seams with ripe lemon, lime, peach and wildflower flavors. Turns as rich as honey on the finish, but it's a dry wine.
Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US

wine_name: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Pedras do Monte Red (Lisboa)
desc: This is a ripe and juicy blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Tinta Roriz. The tannins are present although well integrated into the fine juicy red-fruit flavors. The wine is ready to drink.

Very ripe, powerful and extracted, the wine has a bitter edge, a dark and tannic structure and a dense texture. With its edge of cocoa and layers of wood over the blackberry fruits, it's a wine that will need a while before drinking. Drink from 2016.

wine_name: Felix Solis NV Prospero Grand Selection Rose Secco Sparkling (Spain)
desc: Aromas of leafy red fruits and orange are flaky. This is cloying on the palate, but not without hope. Red-fruit flavors are sugary, while this offers plum and raspberry notes on a finish with notable residual sugar.

wine_name: Santa Helena 2001 Seleccion del Directorio Reserva Merlot (Central Valley)
desc: Modest aromas of cola, mint and lemon peel are clean but hardly stellar. Flavors of cherry, plum and blackberry carry some spice and oak, while the finish is equally oaky and lasting. A touch acidic, but that helps propel the flavors.

Medium-intense and herbal with notes of licorice root and cedar spice among the dark fruit and soft green-pepper flavors. It's easy to drink and well structured with moderate acid and soft but present tannins. A good amount of sweet woody spice lingers though the finish.

The nose is fresh, tasting of bright red summer fruits. On the palate, teh wine has a sweetness to it, but the fruit comes through strongly. Made in a modern but low impact style, it is a genial wine that invites gulping rather than sipping.

This Champagne-method bubbly uses seven different white wine grapes to create a bright, spicy, rather foamy and entirely tasty product. Lemon, orange, apple and pear fruit flavors abound, and the freshness and crisp definition make this a great mixer.

Opens with melon aromas, minerality and a flash of sharp citrus. The palate is still lively and pithy, with mango, nectarine, apricot and apple flavors. This wine seems well balanced and refined, but like so many Verdejos from Rueda it's working on a short lifespan, so catch it now before it fades away.

wine_name: Archery Summit 2013 Renegade Ridge Estate Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
desc: This vineyard was developed between 10 and 20 years ago. The maturing vines deliver a supple yet firm wine, anchored in a core of candy cherry fruit. Aromatic and flavorful highlights of cinnamon, clove and candied orange are also in play, along with a subtle hint of herb.
Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US

wine_name: Bertrand Ambroise 2015 Les Tuvilains Premier Cru  (Beaune)
desc: This opulent wine has great fruitiness. The red-cherry fruits are already generously integrated with the tannins, offering richness. At the same time, acidity gives the wine a crisp edge. Drink from 2023.

wine_name: F X Pichler 2015 Urgestein Terrassen Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)
desc: Freshly cut pear, some peardrop candy and a wonderfully zippy lemon freshness combine on a light, slender body into a very refreshing, even exciting palate that also has very slight echoes of yellow miso and fresh lovage. There is focus and precision—but this may need a little bottle age before unfolding completely. Drink 2017–2022.

Quite mellow on the nose, this blend of 58% Grenache Blanc, 38% Roussanne and 4% Viognier offers very light marzipan and fresh white-peach aromas. It's a very easy to quaff wine on the sip, with lemon-peel and apricot flavors.
Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US

desc: Fuller bodied than the other Kumeu River 2010s, the Coddington Chardonnay displays subtle oak shadings on the nose, then explodes into an array of ripe mango and peach on the palate, underscored by just enough citrus to keep things fresh on the long finish. Drink now–2016.

wine_name: Torres 2001 Grans Muralles Red (Conca de Barberà)
desc: Big in every way, with tons of new oak, popcorn and coffee sitting on top of dark-fruit aromas. Modern despite its incorporation of several indigenous grapes, this blend delivers a blast of roasted black cherry and plum flavors in front of a resiny finish that's dripping with menthol and molasses. Unique if a touch syrupy; it's clearly shooting for the modern style.

Heavy, inky and seemingly a bit overripe, with grassy, doughy, cake-like aromas. The palate is simple and soft, and it comes with deep berry, candy and herbal flavors. More herbal on the finish, with coconut entering the picture.

wine_name: Domaine des Malandes 2018 Vau de Vey Premier Cru  (Chablis)
desc: The touch of wood aging has released the ripe, creamy texture and rich structure of this full-bodied wine. It is intense and mineral, with delicious potential and good acidity at the end. Drink this wine from 2021.
Its soft, gentle tannins, rich plummy, chocolatey flavors and long, spicy finish could only come from Alexander Valley. Perfect with a nice, juicy steak.

Here is a heavily oak-driven expression of Merlot from Sicily that shows layers of cherry, blackberry, chocolate, exotic spice, leather and moist pipe tobacco. The wine is incredibly soft and yielding in the mouth with soft fruit tones on the close.

Catchy aromas such as violet and exotic candle wax are encouraging, maybe a bit more so than the tangy palate, which runs toward red-apple skins and cherry. Light in the middle but tannic on the edges. Fresh and spry, but lean.

wine_name: Ampelos 2016 Ampelos Vineyard Syrache Syrah-Grenache (Sta. Rita Hills)
desc: This is a combination of 65% Syrah and 35% Grenache that showcases each variety well. Tart, tangy and densely textured, it shines in strawberry, cranberry and orange, with a well-integrated tannin structure and balanced weight.
Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US

desc: Earthy, simple and light, with modest cherry and herb flavors. Finishes dry, with a silky mouth feel.
Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US

wine_name: Vilarnau NV Reserva Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
desc: Floral melon and peach aromas are mellow. This feels round, with citrusy acidity cutting into the body. Basic grapefruit and apricot flavors are friendly, while this is a touch foamy on the finish.
Fresh yellow apple and a touch of blossom highlight this plush, creamy white. Juicy and mouthfilling it's balanced by mineral freshness and lingering spice on the finish. Drink now–2024.

wine_name: Riglos 2008 Gran Las Divas Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Tupungato)
desc: Fairly herbal on first take, with green, peppery core aromas coming with wood spice and black fruit. The palate is firm and clacky, with tannic clamp and jammy flavors of baked plum that turn candied the longer it airs out. Sweet and jammy by the time it finishes.

wine_name: Château Crusquet Sabourin 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux
desc: Ripe and fruity, with delicious red berry flavors, this wine is attractive now. It also has some firm tannins built for aging, giving structure to the juicy fruit. Drink from 2019.
Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France

wine_name: Mas Oncle Ernest 2008 Instant Présent Red (Ventoux)
desc: With its distinctively briary, herbal edge, this wine stands out in a crowd. Ample cracked pepper spices up chocolate and plum flavors in this medium-bodied 60-40 blend of Grenache and Syrah. Drink now–2016.

Tinta Roriz is one of the grapes that is very much at home on the granite soils of the Dão. Here winemaker Hugo Chavez produces a structured, densely tannic wine, swathed with loads of red fruit, with acidity to balance. This 100% Tinta Roriz is a powerful wine, needing more aging. Drink from 2016.

wine_name: Or Haganuz 2010 Har Sinai Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Galilee)
desc: This interesting selection offers something different—after being harvested by hand, the grapes were frozen for three days and then heated on an open olive-wood fire before fermenting. The resulting wine is full-bodied yet soft all at once, with dusty tannins that frame the dried berry, plum and black cherry fruit. Accents of crushed cocoa nib and balsamic grace the medium-length finish.

Is it (MS) or the wine? This vintage of Cáceres rosé seems o.k., but nothing more than a splash across the palate. Cotton candy aromas and grapefruit and orange flavors are what they are. Not bad so long as it's fresh, but it's hard to locate much charm or individuality.

91–93. Barrel Sample. This wine is rich and soft, showing ripe blackberry fruits. The tannins are firmly buried in the rich fruit flavors, with bright acidity and ripe fruit tones dominate the palate.

wine_name: Bel Vino NV Grand Reserve Cabernet Franc (California)
desc: Rather joyous aromas of ripe red cherries and light licorice start off this bottling from a winery based in Temecula. The palate shows a bit more dark-red-plum fruit, and the black-licorice touch arises again, remaining fresh throughout.

wine_name: B.R. Cohn 2010 Olive Hill Estate Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
desc: Mint and tarragon come to the fore aromatically in this vineyard-designate, a soft, approachable mix of juicy plum, red berry and chocolate. Fuller in style and ripe, it'll do well on a table of grilled and roasted fare, finishing with a kick of black pepper.

wine_name: Brecon Estate 2017 True Acacia Head Albariño (Central Coast)
desc: Tangy lime-skin aromas meet with yellow pear flesh and a touch of honey on the nose of this bottling, which gains nuance from the acacia wood treatment. There is grippy texture on the palate, where citrus acidity cuts through the Pink Lady apple flavors.
Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US

desc: The 79-acre Domaine la Roquète was acquired by the Brunier family of Vieux Telegraphe in 1986. Its modern labeling belies its dense, huge, packed fruit and tannins that suggest classic Châteauneuf-du-Pape. But there are also great perfumes in the wood and herbal characters. Will age over many years. Imported by Diageo Chateau & Estates.

wine_name: Marrenon 2001 Grand Luberon Red (Côtes du Luberon)
desc: Starts off with a hint of rubber on the nose, but also herbs and black cherries that deepen on the palate into flavors of plum, chocolate and licorice. It's medium-weight and also quite sturdy and tannic, finishing with notes of black tea.
Appellation: Côtes du Luberon, Rhône Valley, France

desc: This blend of Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon, Grenache and Petite Sirah is quite dark in the glass, with blueberry, sharp cedar, clove and vanilla aromas. It coats the palate with soft, lavish tannins, offering zesty black fruit with cappuccino, teriyaki and cracked pepper flavors.
Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US

desc: This offers that tempting aroma of toasted baguette with a dab of butter, then the flavors flow fresh and peachy, while the texture feels smooth and the body not too full. Well balanced between flavors, acidity and body, it brings refreshment to sip after another.

wine_name: Casca Wines 2017 Monte Cascas Colheita Red (Beira Interior)
desc: This wine made from organically grown grapes is soft, open and gentle. Although young and fruity, it is totally ready to drink, shining with red-berry flavors and a light touch of acidity.

wine_name: Santa Margherita NV Extra Dry  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)
desc: Santa Margherita has taken great strides to break into different wines other than its flagship Pinot Grigio. This Extra Dry Prosecco Superiore shows quality and personality with slightly sweet touches of grapefruit and peach spread throughout.
Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy

desc: Dusty, silky tannins wrap themselves around dried herb, cedar and rich, dark chocolate in this powerhouse of a wine, dense and concentrated. Blackberry and currant peak on the lingering, cigar- and clove-tinged finish.

A Bordeaux blend. Starts out with hot-country Cabernet aromas of ripe plums, cassis and asphalt. The fruit is ripe, almost overripe, with raisiny flavors that turn hot and slightly bitter on the finish. Tannins are ultrasoft, and it's not very oaky. Primarily Cabernet Sauvignon, with Merlot and Cabernet Franc.
Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US

desc: Takes this varietal's citrusy, grassy flavors and lifts them into riper fig, melon and peach. The bright acidity is balanced by rich, sweet tannins and a creamy texture from barrel fermentation. The result is a charming wine, dry and satisfying.

wine_name: Lamoreaux Landing 2014 T23 Unoaked Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)
desc: Bright black cherry and raspberry flavors take center stage in this unoaked Cabernet Franc. Juicy and ripe, it's best enjoyed now through 2016 to appreciate its forward, fruity exuberance.
Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US

wine_name: Cellier des Dauphins 2001 Réserve Les Dorinnes Rouge Red (Côtes du Rhône)
desc: A light, simple wine, with modest black cherry flavors partially obscured by rubbery notes.
Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France

desc: Powerful, rich and structured, this wine has weight as well as layers of black fruits and acidity. The producer is based in Nuits-Saint-Georges and so should know a thing or two when it comes to the village wines, and this wine has all the structure and richness of the appellation.

This opens with black, inky intensity and generous aromas of ripe fruit, raspberry, plum, moist earth and pipe tobacco. The mouthfeel is earthy and gritty with astringent tannins on the finish. Hold this for 10–15 years.

wine_name: Mount Eden Vineyards 2000 Estate Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
desc: This tough mountain wine has coffee and tomato aromas and flavors, and bigtime tannins. It's very well oaked, but can't quite come up with the fruit a wine of its size needs. Finishes lean and tannic.
Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US

wine_name: Wine Guerrilla 2007 Forchini Vineyards Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
desc: This seriously good Zin shows off its ancient vineyard's terroir as well as Dry Creek's amenability for Zinfandel. Rich and complex, the wine is very spicy, flooding the mouth with creamy flavors of grilled red cherries, red currants, Fig Newton cookies, mocha and even a hint of sweet, char-broiled beefsteak. Now through 2012.
Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US

wine_name: Château Bellevue la Forêt 2006 Optimum Red (Fronton)
desc: A big wine, with its great floral perfumes dominating the dark tannins and dense texture. The berry fruit is part of this powerful expression of structure. Here the Négrette expresses its pure juicy and tannic character, leaving final very fresh acidity.

wine_name: Quinta dos Roques 2006 Quinta do Correio Red (Dão)
desc: Ripe, soft and fruity, with dense sweet fruit. The wine is approachable, an enticing mix of tannins, spice and coffee. With its fruity finish, the wine is sure to please. The quinta was owned by the local postman, and correio is the word for post in Portuguese.

wine_name: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)
desc: 96-98 Very powerful, concentrated wine with the ripest fruit. Blackberry flavors are supplemented by almost stinging acidity, then mitigated by the velvet tannins. A wine that will age for several decades.

wine_name: Companhia das Quintas 2010 Quinta do Cardo Red (Beira Interior)
desc: The high altitude Cardo vineyard always produces finely structured wines that need aging. This firm, initially austere wine shows good potential as its bright red fruits develop and the firmer tannins come into balance. The acidity gives a fine freshness to the aftertaste. Drink from 2015.

Salmon colored, with light melon and almond aromas that are hardly distinct but by the same token are nice enough. Sweet and simple in the mouth, with no discernible fruit flavor to latch onto. Imported by Broadbent Selections, Inc.

Plump but pertly balanced cassis and black fig are shaded by hints of anise and pepper in this rich, penetrating red. A blend of unoaked Grenache (70%), Cinsault (15%) and Syrah (15%) sourced from rocky red-clay soil, it's gorgeously fruity but spicy and earthen too. Ready now the wine should improve through 2027.
Soft and simple, with very ripe, almost Porty flavors of caramelized blackberry pie, currants and chocolate-covered raisins, with a hot finish.

Smoke and dusty mineral tones accent zesty pineapple and pear in this full-bodied, freshly concentrated blend of six regional white-grape varieties. The palate is concentrated but irresistibly quaffable, with a pristine and mineral finish. It's best enjoyed young.

wine_name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2013 Galets Oligocène Pinot Noir (Alsace)
desc: The nose is a subtle combination of the merest touch of cinnamon and red cherry. The palate is light and firm, with ample freshness and a lovely impression of tart fruit. This is understated and fresh in a savory style.

wine_name: La Bollina 2018 del Comune di Gavi  (Gavi)
desc: This has an extremely shy nose that eventually reveals whiffs of camphor and medicinal herbs. The brisk palate offers bitter almond, lemon and yellow apple skin alongside brisk acidity.

wine_name: Pine Ridge 2003 Crimson Creek Merlot (Napa Valley)
desc: This is a blend of grapes from Carneros, Rutherford, Oakville and Stags Leap. One thing it offers is fruit. Red and black cherries and blackberries, to be exact, on the jammy side, with a spicy lift of new oak. It's not a complex ager, but it does show real white-tablecloth fanciness.

wine_name: Dutton-Goldfield 2016 Azaya Ranch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap)
desc: Firm, solidly built and slightly restrained at first sip, this medium-bodied wine has a deep color, concentrated fruit aromas and focused black-fruit flavors on the palate. Firm tannins and acidity give it a grippy mouthfeel while just-ripe black cherry and black tea dominate the flavors.

A blend of 41% Grenache, 37% Syrah, 14% Mourvèdre, 4% Counoise and 4% Cinsault from seven vineyards, this longtime Margerum-fan favorite shows boisterous wild berries, allspice-laced brioche, juicy hibiscus and fresh watermelon notes on the fun, inviting nose. It's juicy, light and easy drinking, with hints of anise and dried mint that give character to the bright red fruit.
Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US

wine_name: Dutton-Goldfield 2016 Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
desc: From a selection of fine vineyards from throughout the appellation, this wine impresses in its stemmy earthy character of forest pine and fresh light-bodied juicy layers of strawberry, rhubarb and tangerine. This is a widely appealing wine that's balanced and bright.
Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US

desc: A light shade of pink in the glass, this bottling offers aromas of light cherry and plum alongside wet earth and rocks. There is a decent grip to the sip, where dried earth and light berry flavors align.
Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US

wine_name: Domenica Amato 2016 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
desc: The vineyard shines in this white, a focused, fresh and fleshy expression of stone, mineral, lemon zest and peel. Light bodied and fresh in the glass, it has a bite of power and tannin on the finish.
Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US

wine_name: Cherrier Père et Fils 2018 Les 7 Hommes  (Sancerre)
desc: This rich Sancerre is full of white fruits as well as the more familiar herbal characteristics. It is taut, with a sculptured texture. The wine is not quite ready and will be better from early 2020.

wine_name: Vicente Gandia 2016 Finca del Mar Chardonnay Chardonnay (Valencia)
desc: A tan color and dusty, tired aromas put this Chardonnay on short notice. Its plump palate delivers a mix of stone fruit and bitter, skin-based flavors, with a static finish.

wine_name: Château les Charmes Godard 2012  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux
desc: Fruity and perfumed, this is an attractive, juicy wine. Red berry and red currant fruits from the 27-acre estate give the wine freshness, gently underlined by the tannins. Drink from 2017.
Appellation: Francs Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France

desc: If you want perfumed Pinot Noir, this is the wine for you. It is aromatic, full of that sexy, fresh fruit that appeals to Central Coast California Pinot Noir lovers. Yet the structure and the elegance are all Burgundy. And the aftertaste is packed with red fruits and delicious acidity.

Reduction in the way of flinty smoke still clouds the nose. The palate, however, convinces with its very freshness, by its bright, crisp, crunchy cherry fruit. This brightness is also supported by a little cheeky spritz. A very fresh-faced, honest, pure and vivid Zweigelt that will work brilliantly when chilled.

Starts out odd and exotic, with blueberry and Middle Eastern spice aromas. Feels condensed and jammy, with full flavors of herbs, boysenberry and plum. Shows freshness along with simplicity, with finishing herbal notes of sage and tarragon. Contains 10% each Merlot and Cabernet.
Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain

wine_name: Bacio Divino 2013 Lucie Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
desc: Nuanced oak and creamy, balanced layers of lemon, pear and fig characterize this wine, which retains ample acidity and texture, bottled unfined and unfiltered. Concentrated and refined, it's distinctive for the table and the cellar.
Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US

desc: Barolo Lorens delivers interesting dimension and personality with a complex bouquet comprised of fruit, spice and cola elements. The aromatic intensity is given a natural lift thanks to the wine's dense pulp and velvety consistency. Sweet cherry flavors fuel a long finish.

wine_name: Kirrenbourg SAS 2018 Roche Granitique Pinot Gris (Alsace)
desc: Funky smokiness still obscures any fruit on the nose of this wine. The palate comes in with uncommon concentration and unusual freshness for a 2018. Homing in on stoniness rather than fruit, the wine channels energy and power towards its lasting, dry and fresh finish. Drink by 2035.

This dark, brooding red pulsates with fleshy black-cherry and plum flavors. Intensely ripe and densely concentrated, it's a fiery powerhouse framed by firm, gripping tannins. Bold and slightly bullish now it should integrate beautifully with time. Hold till 2021 but it's likely to improve through 2040.

It's the Antão Vaz, the Chardonnay of Portugal, that gives this such class. It is full, tasty and complex, with acidity and superripeness, but still elegant white fruits. Additional richness comes from lees-stirring after fermentation, giving a fine depth of flavor.
Good price for a lusty Zin filled with ripe cherry, blackberry and chocolate flavors. It has that briary nettle quality that marks the variety, and is soft.
Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US

wine_name: Domaine de Piaugier 2004 Montmartel Sablet Red (Côtes du Rhône Villages)
desc: This luxury cuvée is a blend of 80% Grenache and 20% Mourvèdre, aged partially in barriques for up to two years. The wood has been nicely integrated into the bold cherry flavors, but the finish is sternly tannic. Needs 2–3 years.
Appellation: Côtes du Rhône Villages, Rhône Valley, France

desc: This wine is a blend of Merlot, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon. The aromas pop, with notes of raspberry, plum, herb and spice. The palate brings a mixture of fruit and savory flavors, with the tannins bringing a lightly tacky feel. There's much to enjoy.
Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US

wine_name: Caves Transmontanas 2006 Vértice Bruto Pinot Noir (Douro)
desc: Disgorged in 2014, this pale rosé wine definitely has bottle age. You can taste it in the toasty character and in the acidity that has matured along with the wine. It is fresh rather than ripe—a wine that is now very ready to drink.

An opening of burnt rubber, forced hickory and mulchy tomato aromas is none too impressive. Feels tannic and beefy, with leafy, choppy red berry flavors. Burnt and herbal tasting on the finish. Underwhelming as a whole.

wine_name: Trisaetum 2018 Wichmann Dundee Estate Dry Riesling (Dundee Hills)
desc: A waxy scent leads quickly into a focused, sharply defined wine with a dense mix of apple, lemon, grapefruit and citrus rind. It's crisp and tart, but with flavors that dive deep into the palate and linger gracefully.
Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US

desc: Beneath aromas of onion and menthol lurk faint tones of strawberry, red cherry and herb. The palate is slippery and fruity, with a decent lick of acidity. It closes on a juicy red cherry finish.

wine_name: La Collina dei Lecci 2006 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)
desc: This wine presents a dark wall of inky concentration with aromas of ripe fruit and raw cherry. There are earthy tones in the background that are characteristic of Sangiovese, with floral and menthol nuances as well. The tannins are firm and polished.

This wine tastes heavy and rounded, with whiffs of petroleum and peppermint on the entry that settle down over time. With ripe fruit and oak at its core, it's a wine for fans of a more generous style.
Soft, sweet and chocolaty, with gooey raspberry, cherry and currant flavors. Decadently good in its own way, but kind of candy simple in its appeal. Ready now.
Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US

desc: Although this is a delicate wine in terms of aroma and flavor, it has a vividly tart texture that's especially refreshing. It smells subdued, resembling cucumber and white pepper, then the flavors add white peach and crisp apple notes. This will make a great match with raw oysters, sushi and other appetizers.

This blend of two characteristic Douro grapes, Rabigato and Códega do Larinho, is smooth, rounded and full of fruit, while also being textured and crisp. A full-bodied wine, it needs more aging. Drink from 2019.

wine_name: Sheldrake Point 2015 Reserve Estate Bottled Gamay Noir (Finger Lakes)
desc: How delightful that Gamay grows in the Finger Lakes and further more that Sheldrake Point has managed to coax out its unique attributes there. This reserve bottling showcases Gamay's bright cherry and strawberry flavors, with elegant tones of tomato leaf, nut and granite. It's deft and crisply composed with a fine, feathery kiss of tannins.
Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US

wine_name: Caliterra 2007 Tributo Edicion Limitada Red (Colchagua Valley)
desc: Rooty and rich at first blush, with dark, black fruit aromas leading the charge. The palate is lively and snappy, with fleshy but short flavors of blackberry, cassis liqueur and coconut. Quite extracted and full but also a touch hard and short, with a few holes in the texture. Carmenère (60%) and Malbec (40%).

Fragrant floral and fruit tones characterize this luminous Chardonnay from northern Italy and give the wine a cheerful aromatic lift and a sense of liveliness. This is a well-made, simple but crisp wine with a nice feeling of density and creaminess in the mouth.

This wine isn't too thick in the middle, but packs a wallop around the edges, coating the mouth with zingy lemon and lime flavors. Its chalk-dust texture is its best feature. Imported by Guardian of the Grape Imports.

wine_name: La Playa 2013 Block Selection Tinga Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)
desc: Dry, dusty blackberry aromas are restrained yet clean. This shows more density on a palate, with jammy black-plum and berry flavors leading to a fresh and satisfying full-length finish.
Tannins and strong smoky wood flavors dominate this wine.Very dark and dry in texture, its fruitiness hides behind all this hard structure and dense character.

A strong cigar-box aroma meets with black currant, blackberry and black-cherry juice on the rather elegant nose of this good-value bottling. The flavors are clean, with licorice, dried herbs, black cherry and pipe tobacco, and are framed by decent tannins.
Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US

desc: Light strawberry, earth and rose-petal aromas add to the blackberry flavors in this medium-bodied wine. It feels tight and tastes lean now, so it's best to drink after 2019.

From this red-hot AVA, this exciting Chard rocks with bold, penetrating fruit. You can taste the cool ocean tang, which coaxed out apples and citrus, while winemaker bells and whistles, such as barrel fermentation and sur lie aging, provide welcome complexities. They completed the malolactic fermentation, which softens the wine a bit but makes it buttery and creamy.

The chalk subsoil of the Bélingard estate gives this wine its textured character. The wood aging smoothes out the crisp acidity of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon and adds a light layer of toast. It is still a young wine and will be better from late 2016 or even 2017.

wine_name: Hargrave NV Fleurette Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)
desc: A lightweight Pinot that's actually marketed as a rosé, this wine nevertheless manages to pack in decent flavors of apple skin, red berries and cinnamon, capped off by some leathery, meaty notes.
Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US

desc: This white's aromas are quite nice and feminine, but the palate disappoints. Vague yellow fruit and chalk flavors are dilute and over before it starts. If the flavors showed the promise that the nose showed, it would have been a much better wine.
Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia

desc: With its light color, this is a soft and fruity wine that is now beginning to mature. Its red berries are acquiring a more barnyard character, while acidity is merging into the ripe texture. It's ready to drink.

wine_name: J. Davies 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
desc: This '06 continues the winery's recent successes in Cabernet. It's a lush, opulent wine. In its youth the smoky oak stars, along with waves of blackberries, black currants, plums and a spicy, meaty note suggesting bacon. Beautiful now, although tight in tannins, it should develop bottle aromatics and complexities for at least the next six years.
Appellation: Diamond Mountain District, Napa, California, US

wine_name: Medlock Ames 2008 Bell Mountain Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
desc: This Cab wants a few more years to let its internal inconsistencies resolve. The primary cherry and blackberry fruit has faded and is turning nutty. But it's still pretty tannic. Needs to throw some sediment to let the inherent fruit emerge. Try after 2016.

Notes of salt, baked earth and crushed stones act as base notes to this succulent but restrained Gigondas. Aged entirely in concrete tanks, it's subtle and nuanced, suggesting a transparency of black fruit flavors and a deep earthiness that lingers. Ripe, integrated tannins ring the finish. A lovely wine to enjoy now–2030.

wine_name: Envy 2007 Nord Vineyard Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
desc: Shows real elegance and finesse in a variety that can sometimes get a little out of control. With smoothly polished tannins giving it a full-bodied mouthfeel, this single-vineyard wine has rich blackberry, black currant and pepper flavors. Fine now, and should develop for many years.

True to type and admirably wild in flavors, this wine emphasizes meaty, savory, forest-floor aromas and rich but not overtly fruity flavors. It is full bodied, mouthfilling and complex. Woodsy, grilled-herb and smoked meat flavors expand on the palate and linger on the finish.
Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US

wine_name: Alain Jaume et Fils 2010 Domaine Grand Veneur Blanc de Viognier (Côtes du Rhône)
desc: Viognier from the Southern Rhône can often be overripe and heavy, but while this offering from Grand Veneur is full bodied and richly textured, it remains reasonably fresh. Apricot, pineapple and passion fruit flavors mingle easily on the palate, finishing clean and long. Drink now.
Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France

desc: This is a ripe, jammy red wine with sweet cherry aromas and plump background notes of blackberry preserve and exotic spice. It offers an easy, approachable personality, with a touch of chewy sweetness on the finish.

wine_name: Murdoch James Estate 2002 Blue Rock Pinot Noir (Martinborough)
desc: Starts with notes of toasted cinnamon, cola and root beer on the nose that give way to flavors of sour cherries, beets and sasparilla in the mouth. Light in body, with crisp acids yet virtually no tannins. Drink now. Imported by McDevitt & McDevitt Importers.
Simple cherry and strawberry flavors compete for attention with a dried herb accent in this dry, light-bodied wine.

Amity has made a dry gewurz since 1977, and it is frequently a standout, but seems to have slipped a bit in this vintage. It's soft and creamy, with ripe fruit flavors, but missing the snap and precision that makes the grape memorable.

Rich, layered and brimming in dense plum, baked fig and blueberry, this is a spicy, robust and mineral-driven red wine. With softened tannins and integrated oak, it allows the fruit to speak loudest, with well-seasoned accents and plenty of length on the finish.

Ultrarich, an oily, unctuous wine offering tiers of pineapples, pears, limes and mangoes, enriched with sweet, smoky oak. Made in the superripe California style, yet always retains a crisp, dry elegance.

This Torontel is elegant and stately, delivering apricot, peach, mango and spice aromas on the bouquet. A fruity, full-bodied palate is sticky but braced by proper acidity, while cinnamon, caramel, toffee and baked pear flavors finish long and yummy.

wine_name: Cave de Beblenheim NV Blanc de Noirs Heimberger Brut Pinot Noir (Alsace)
desc: The honeyed notes on the nose almost have a savory soy-scented quality. These savory notes of stone and yeast also hover on the palate which is dry and replaces primary fruit with honeyed fluidity against the canvas of yeasty autolysis. This works not only as a dry refreshing apéritif but as an accompaniment to delicate foods.
Toasted nut, bread crust and mature yellow stone-fruit aromas lead the nose. The vibrant palate offers creamy yellow apple, tangy lemon zest and almond alongside a lively perlage.
Tightly wound, it opens slowly into a solid, full-flavored, rather chunky style of Pinot laced with the flavors of cola, root beer and vanilla. Plump and juicy, it's enjoyable rather than profound.

wine_name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2009 Brand Grand Cru Vieilles Vignes Riesling (Alsace)
desc: This intense wine has great ripe fruit and sweetness to go with the pear and honey flavors. There is great acidity and beautiful fruit character in a gorgeous wine that still keeps its style and freshness.
The wine is noted as off dry on the back label, but you won't taste any sweetness whatsoever. It's tart, green, almost sour, with green apple fruit that hints at cardboard in the finish.
Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US

wine_name: Jean Laurent NV Blanc de Blancs Réserve Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
desc: Coming from the warmer Aube region, Laurent's Chardonnay offering is ripe and hinting at yellow fruits while also retaining a steely, mineral character. It is fresh, rich, well textured and ready to drink, crisp and bright at the end.

Equal parts Grenache and Syrah are blended with 18% Mourvèdre in this classic red Rhône blend. Broad, with fleshy tannins, it has a meaty character, brightened by flavors of baked strawberry, chocolate and smoky oak.

Plush notes of blueberry preserve and black-cherry jam are offset by shards of graphite, smoke and earth in this rich, satisfying red. Balanced with crisp acidity and bold, taut tannins, it's enjoyable now but structured enough to improve through 2027 and hold further still.

Distinctly Zinny in the wild blackberry and raspberry flavors and that briary, brambly mouthfeel, with its overtones of pepper. This is a medium-bodied wine with very soft tannins. It's dry, but there's a creamy cocoa taste on the finish.

wine_name: D'Arenberg 2007 The Lucky Lizard Chardonnay (Adelaide Hills)
desc: D'Arenberg is better known for its red wines, but this promising effort from the Adelaide Hills is one to watch. Vanilla and custardy notes mark the nose, while the flavors turn toasty and cereal-like, backed by plenty of mixed citrus fruit. It's not overly rich or ripe, but has long, mouthwatering finish.

wine_name: Darby 2011 The Dark Side Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
desc: Crushed rock, tar, herb and white pepper aromas are followed by full-bodied, tangy dried-cherry and spice flavors. The finish lingers.
Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US

wine_name: Terre de Trinci 2000 Ugolino  (Sagrantino di Montefalco)
desc: This wine has a great nose: layers of spice, leather, black cherry, prunes, candied licorice and cinnamon. Oak aging renders a smooth, round mouthfeel and good structure. Imported by John Given Wines.
Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy

desc: Toasty, buttery and round in the mouth, with yellow fruit underneath. Fruit, not toast, is the key player on the finish. The nose offers a strange mix of mustard, meat and beef aromas.

Waffles and maple syrup in the aroma, and blackberries in the flavor seem to recommend this full-bodied wine for breakfast time. In fact it is a little sweet, and those maple-like notes continue in the flavors along with vanilla and cinnamon.

Lemony crisp with complementary tangerine, this wine is full and fleshy on the palate within a context of forceful acidity and coastal minerality. A wealth of length and breadth keeps it complex and inviting in the glass, with hints of nutmeg and brioche.

On the nose, fresh earth and dark blackberry notes are coated in a milky-calcium aroma. The wine will certainly have wide appeal, given its light-to-medium body and red berry-oak-leather profile. It's two-thirds Cabernet Sauvignon, with Merlot, Malbec and Shiraz taking up the slack.
Pineapple, guava and grapefruit lead the way in this refreshing wine. There's a good lick of acidity that's balanced by ripe fruit flavors.

wine_name: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2011 Fazedouro Red (Douro)
desc: A new venture to the Douro by Tejo-based Lagoalva, this is juicy, fruity and soft. While it misses the minerality of many Douro wines, it does have ripe plum fruit flavors, and an open, generous texture. This is a warm full-bodied wine that's ready to drink.

wine_name: Quinta dos Avidagos 2017 Avidagos Colheita Tinto Red (Douro)
desc: Ripe berry fruits are now softening well to give a ripe, fruity wine that has touches of spice and a smoky character. The wine, with its red-berry flavors, is ready to drink.

Spice and black fruits work well with the big tannins of this wine. It will always be dry and structured, although those tannins are already softening. The combination of fruit, tannin and acidity is impressive. This wine could age further until 2022.

Named after the scenic highway that runs along the coastal mountains, this unoaked Chard is bone dry, crisp in acids, and lean. The flavors are of grapefruits and limes. A very elegant wine that appeals for its clean balance and zest.

wine_name: Kontokosta 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)
desc: Fresh green apple, lemon and gooseberry notes abound in this gorgeously fruity and juicy Sauvignon Blanc. It's surprisingly bold on the palate: full bodied and supple yet balanced. Flavors of ripe white grapefruit and quince are concentrated yet brisk. A hint of musky spray marks the finish. Drink now through 2020.
Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US

wine_name: Rocca Bernarda 2006 Pinot Grigio Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)
desc: This is a simple, correct PG with aromas of citrus and grapefruit backed by a hint of almond. It also offers good a balance between sweet fruit flavors and spicy acidity.
Appellation: Colli Orientali del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy

wine_name: MacPhail 2012 The Flyer Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
desc: Intensely earthy, this wine hails predominantly from Susanna's Vineyard, a site in the heart of the Green Valley section of the larger Russian River Valley that's known for its elevation and coolness. Here, crisp raspberry and cherry do provide a sense of that coolness, but the wine develops into a substantial behemoth of full-bodied richness and weight, with a powerful, peppery finish.
Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US

wine_name: Elio Filippino 2013 del Comune di La Morra  (Barolo)
desc: Subtle aromas of mocha, espresso, cedar and a hint of blue flowers waft out of the glass. The dense palate evokes dried black cherry, licorice and roasted coffee bean alongside grainy tannins that give it a rather astringent finish. Drink after 2022.

wine_name: Craggy Range 2001 Old Renwick Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
desc: Citrus and gooseberry define the all-fruit nose. In the mouth, you'll encounter the full allotment of cantaloupe, citrus and green herbs, particularly basil. The tangy finish is like grapefruit sorbet after a nice meal; it cleanses the palate, leaving no residue at all. It's refined, racy and tips the scale at just the right weight.

wine_name: Domaine de Suremain 2016 La Bondue Premier Cru  (Mercurey)
desc: This structured, firm wine is packed with tannins as well as warm red fruits. Cherries and strawberries dominate the flavor spectrum although restrained by the tannin and wood-aging structure. This rich wine has good aging potential. Drink from 2022.

Compared to previous vintages, this wine shows improvements. It is lightly perfumed on the nose, with dry, peppery fruit scents. The palate is fresh and crisp, although the cherry and raspberry flavors are sort of thin. Simple and adequate Pinot from Argentina.

Forest floor, red-skinned berry, leather and tobacco aromas mingle with a balsamic note. The focused, structured palate delivers juicy Morello cherry, raspberry compote and licorice while a graphite note backs up the finish. A backbone of fine-grained tannins and bright acidity gives it an age-worthy structure. Drink 2021–2034.

From 100% estate-grown grapes, and possessing 6.8 g/L of residual sugar, this wine is lovely in peach, pear and lemon, and quite voluptuous in texture, with a hint of spice. Pretty floral aromas of jasmine provide additional flourish and invitation, with the finish dry.
Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US

wine_name: Château Bourseau 2011 La Croix de Bourseau  (Lalande de Pomerol)
desc: This is a super cuvée from Bourseau with dense dark extracted tannins and concentrated fruits. It is rich, almost too rich, full of powerful fruits, black plum skins and a young firm structure. It will remain dry and tannic for several more years, so don't drink before 2020.

A blend of Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Sauvignon, this has a moderately intense nose of dark cherry, tobacco and spiced cocoa, with light herbal inflections. On the palate, the acidity is the driving force, creating tart, succulent flavors of mixed stone fruits and blue fruits.

wine_name: Pierre Sparr 2012 Mambourg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)
desc: A closed nose leads to a very fruity, off-dry palate of rich pear flavors: juicy and ripe but tinged with more grounded notes of fresh earth. This is flowing and rounded but fresh and beautifully textured.

This huge, fruity wine is packed with tannins and superripe fruits. It's a big wine in all senses, from its massive structure to its bold red berry flavors. There's a ripe, juicy end to this powerful wine.

wine_name: Maryhill 2016 Elephant Mountain Vineyard Sangiovese (Rattlesnake Hills)
desc: The aromas are reserved, with notes of cherry pie, dried herb and spice. Plump red and black fruit flavors follow, with enough acidity and tannin structure to stand it up straight. It shows some warmth on the finish.
Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US

desc: This is a beautifully perfumed wine. With a high proportion of ripe Cabernet Franc, it is not only structured but has a fine dried fruit character that gives the wine a memorable richness. The wine is tight with its tannins, likely to age over decades. Drink from 2027.

wine_name: Sterling 1997 Diamond Mountain Ranch Vyd Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
desc: The big, very dark and inviting nose of ripe cherry, licorice, cocoa and toast sets things up. The dense palate is packed with cherry, tar, even bacon notes, and it has a plush, velvety feel that belies the wine's structure. The impressive finish is dark and toasty, with well-dispersed tannins. Cellar two to four years.

wine_name: Macari 2001 Reserve Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)
desc: A toasty, vanilla-scented Merlot that boasts a plump, appealing mouthfeel, but seems to lack sufficient fruit to carry the weight of all the oak. Finishes with a hint of mocha.
Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US

desc: A strong scent and flavor of root beer comes out of this clonal selection. The black cherry fruit carries it through the midpalate, then the wine seems to thin out and lose a bit of focus.

From Margaret River in Western Australia, this is a full-bodied, impressively endowed Shiraz at a reasonable price. Superripe aromas of blackberries and licorice mark the nose, while the palate features similar flavors, supple tanins and a creamy-textured finish. Good to go now, with enough concentration to hold until 2015.

Shows an awful lot of wood, with vanilla and coconut notes dominating the blackberry fruit. The chewy tannins are omnipresent, but they're soft and lasting on the finish, giving us hope that this will evolve in a positive direction.

wine_name: Domaine Mersiol 2015 Frankstein Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
desc: Juicy peach and aromatic orange make for an appetizing fruit-driven opening. The palate adds an element of pure zestiness and bright freshness to these exuberant, ripe and enticing fruit notes. This masters this playful tension between fruit and freshness beautifully. There is a touch of heat on the just-about-dry finish, but this spells fun, full fruit and total refreshment. Drink 2017–2025.

wine_name: Domaine du Grand Cros 2015 L'Esprit de Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
desc: Dominated by Grenache (60%), this wine is soft and easily fruity. Along with attractive flavors of red fruits, pear and citrus, it has a light tang of lime zest and a ripe, full-bodied aftertaste.

The fruit flavors are plum and blackberry, with warm, meaty notes and hints of mocha and dill. The varietal character shows most in the wine's feel on the palate, which is ample but just slightly austere and restrained. Drink now–2020.

A dull sense of rich oak is all this wine gives away on its shy nose for now but the palate swishes in with liveliness. Red-cherry juiciness conquers the toned body that is made precise by firm, fine tannin. Fruity waves crash deliciously against the structure, releasing aroma and freshness on this elegant but energtic wine. Wonderful.
Enormously rich and ripe with flavors of blackberry and cherry jam, gingerbread and caramel, this Malbec-based blend has soft, complex tannins. Its best opened soon, to drink with beef dishes.
Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US

desc: Ripe yellow apple melds with brisk lemon-lime on the nose and palate of this semidry Riesling. While it's light in concentration, it's a tasty mix of juicy fruit and zesty citrus.
Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US

wine_name: Yangarra Estate Vineyard 2005 Cadenzia Grenache-Shiraz-Mourvèdre Red (McLaren Vale)
desc: Cadenzia is a term the McLaren Vale producers have agreed to use on their top Grenache-based blends; in this instance it's 47% Grenache, 41% Shiraz and only 12% Mourvèdre. Like Yangarra's other wines, this one is heavily extracted, with dark flavors of chocolate, cassis and coffee. There's intense fruit, backed by firm structure and some spice; hold 1–2 years, then drink it over the next 5–8. Imported by Sovereign Wine Imports.

Aromas of blackberry, spicy plum, grilled herb, Mediterranean scrub and a whiff of pencil shavings lead the nose on this polished wine. The savory palate offers juicy plum, black cherry, clove and white pepper alongside supple, buffed tannins that generate a smooth mouth texture. Drink through 2017.

wine_name: Davies 2012 Londer Vineyards Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
desc: Davies has been making Pinot Noir since 2009. Firm, lively acidity and generous tannins in this complex wine lift up the distinctive cherry and clove flavors. A sharp balance means the fruit flavors and fine structure fill each other out for a harmonious whole.
Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US

wine_name: Six Mile Creek 2010 Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)
desc: This is zesty and bright, bearing puckery pomegranate and red berry flavors, with an element of briny, umami-laden goodness that brings truffles and smoked nuts to mind. Soft tannins lead to a sour-cherry-flavored finish that's flecked with notes of herbs and dried leaves.
Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US

desc: Ripe Alvarinho gives a wine that is rich as well as crisp and dry. This wine, with its hints of apricot as well as citrus fruits has a piercing line of acidity along with the tangy texture and ripe aftertaste. It is ready to drink.

wine_name: La Crema 2004 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
desc: The best, most complex of La Crema's three appellation series Pinot Noirs shows true Russian River character. It's medium- to full-bodied, with oak-tinged cherry compote, root beer and cocoa flavors. Tannic weight could help it improve for a couple of years.
Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US

wine_name: Château de Farel 2014 Red (Côtes du Rhône)
desc: This is a bouncy, fresh, fruit-forward wine. Cherry-berry fruit shines from start to finish, ending with just a hint of cocoa. Drink now–2017.
Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France

desc: Dark berry, resin, brown baking spice and menthol aromas lead the way. The firm tightly knit palate offers black cherry, licorice, sage and espresso alongside assertive grainy tannins and nervous acidity. Drink 2018–2023.

wine_name: W.T. Vintners 2010 Gorgeous Syrah Destiny Ridge Vineyard Syrah (Horse Heaven Hills)
desc: Fermented with 30% whole clusters and aged 20 months in neutral French oak, this is a distinctive wine with notes reminiscent of sage along with white pepper, violets and a tinge of copper. Designed for the dinner table, the palate is lighter in style with tart acidity.
Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US

wine_name: Murganheira 2004 Bruto Chardonnay (Vinho Espumante de Qualidade)
desc: Rounded, warm wine, its walnut and kiwi fruit balanced by a soft texture. It has preserved its freshness, allowing the acidity to shine through. A serious wine, as well as delicious, to drink now.

wine_name: Columbia Crest 2013 Grand Estates Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
desc: Half of this wine is Merlot, with the rest Cabernet Franc, Malbec, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Blueberry, coffee and vanilla aromas are followed by sultry plum flavors speckled with barrel accents before a mocha-flavored finish.
Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US

desc: An elegant surprise from Michigan, this sparkling Riesling starts with fresh apple and pear aromas and leads into balanced layers of fruit and creamy toast. Aromatic and a touch sweet, it finishes dry and snappy. A fun find.
This crisp, tangy wine is packed with citrus flavors. Brightly textured with a mineral edge, it is fruity, hinting at spice along with a floral, fresh character.

This luminous, ruby-red blend of 85% Sangiovese, 10% Ciliegiolo and 5% Alicante starts with intense aromas of forest floor, underbrush, berry and tobacco. Lively, juicy fruit flavors are accented with mint, black pepper and thyme accompanied by bracing tannins. Give this a couple of more years to come around. Vos Selections, Tosco Wine.

wine_name: Dante Robere 2017 Suky's Syrah Syrah-Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)
desc: This heavily toasted, salt-and-pepper wine spent 28 months aging in new French barrels. It offers plenty of charred oak and meat in the aroma, dark-chocolate and blackberry in the flavors, and moderate tannins for a grippy mouthfeel.
Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US

wine_name: Gitton Père et Fils 2018 Les Montachins  (Sancerre)
desc: Tight, flinty and steely, this is full of crisp green fruits and herbal flavors shot through with minerality. The texture and acidity give an immediate freshness that will soften as the wine ages. Drink from 2020.
Light pink in color, this wine offers generous aromas of forest fruit and citrus. It has enough depth and creaminess to pair with a spicy Thai mango salad.

Savory black-olive aromas lend some funk to the nose of this tight pointy massively tannic Tempranillo. Flavors of olive, black fruits and chocolate finish with hard drying tannins and flavors of black coffee, additional chocolate and peppery spice. Drink from 2018–2030.
Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain

desc: A blend of 44% Syrah, 31% Grenache and 25 Mourvèdre, this wine is aromatically very pure, with plenty of red and blue fruit, speckled with bay leaf, herb and black-pepper accents. It possesses a thrilling plush mouthfeel, with olive and black-fruit flavors, showing a fine sense of purity.
Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US

wine_name: Domaine Uby 2014 No. 3 Colombard-Ugni Blanc Colombard-Ugni Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)
desc: This smooth, creamy textured wine combines bright acidity with ripe apricot and pear flavors. It is already attractive in its freshness while also having a rounder character. Drink now.
Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France

desc: Starts with refined aromas of smoke, toast, butter, spice and tropical fruits; also a nearly vegetal herbal overtone. The creamy texture and tropical fruit flavors are framed by heavy oak.

wine_name: Vincent Lumpp 2017 La Grande Berge Premier Cru  (Givry)
desc: From one of two Lumpp estates in Givry, this wine is soft and open. Its warm, spicy character emphasizes the ripe, floral nature of the grapes in this vintage. It is ready to drink.

wine_name: Central Coast Group Project 2013 Barrington Hall Wine Dinner Special Cuvée Red (Santa Barbara County)
desc: Scott Sampler is employing some avant-garde techniques in his winemaking, including extra long macerations, but this blend of 50% Grenache, 25% Mourvèdre and 25% Syrah is relatively straightforward. Aromas of stewed blackberry and red currant meet with licorice spice and a leathery richness on the nose. The palate shows black raspberry, vanilla dust, gingerbread and minty tarragon, laid upon a still-tight texture with lively acidity.
Designation: Barrington Hall Wine Dinner Special Cuvée
Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US

desc: Delicate crushed-stone minerality extends from nose to finish in this crisp blackberry-accented red. It's silky and full in body but impeccably balanced with integrated alcohol and a luscious, mouth clinging finish. Chalky, penetrating tannins lend structure. Enjoy now–2025.

wine_name: Rocca delle Macìe 2000 Roccato Cabernet Sauvignon-Sangiovese (Toscana)
desc: Deeply colored, with intense crude oil, black plum and tobacco aromas. The palate is chunky as can be, with dark plum, blackberry and char. Where this one steers off course is on the mouthfeel, where extruding tannins create a raw, scratchy feel on the insides of one's cheeks.

This ripe, wood-aged wine has fragrant red-cherry flavors and good acidity. It's still young, so it does have some bitterness, although the rich fruits and structure all point to a good future. Drink from 2017.

wine_name: Salvestrin 2006 Salvestrin Estate Vineyard Three-D Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
desc: As ripely fruity and oaky as any Cab out there, offering a flood of blackberries, currants, cherries, raspberries, mocha and sweet, smoky new oak. Yet lifted up by the tannin-inspired structure and a welcome, herbaceous note of olives. Marries the best of the old and new styles, a terrific Cabernet that will develop for 6–8 years.

wine_name: Bevela 2019 White Lotus Camp 4 Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
desc: Very light in the glass, this bottling begins with crisp aromas of Alpine water alongside hints of red apple and honeysuckle. There's a compelling almond-cream flavor on the palate, where passion fruit and apple-blossom elements make for a refreshing sip.
Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US

wine_name: Sandler 2018 Cortada Alta Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
desc: Heavier aromas of liquefied violets and black-plum syrup show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is also rich and quite extracted, with flavors of roasted black plum, crushed pepper and thyme.
Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US

desc: Dark, with a heavy warmth to the nose and lots of earth and toast. Comes on more racy in the mouth, with snappy red-cherry and roasted plum flavors. Gets harder and harder as it opens, displaying heat and tannin. Needs better balance and cushion.
Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain

wine_name: Fritz 2013 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
desc: Almost entirely fermented in stainless steel, it has unquestionable acidity captured in the bottle, without a sacrifice of ripe, juicy peach fruit. Lemongrass lingers on the tail end.
Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US

wine_name: Alta Alella 2017 Bruant Organic Natural Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
desc: Green apple, pear and mineral aromas comprise a nose with nothing overt. On the palate, this is light on bubbles and high in malic acidity, which is typical for the brut nature style. Lime, green apple and Bartlett pear flavors are clean and lean on the finish.

wine_name: Villacezan 2001 Doce Meses Red (Vino Tierra de León)
desc: Muddled to start, with chocolate and earth aromas along with heavy, seemingly chewable berry fruit. Big on the palate, with slightly overripe plum backed by overt vanilla and brown sugar. A three-grape mix of Prieto Pecudo, Mencía and Tempranillo.
Appellation: Vino Tierra de León, Northern Spain, Spain

wine_name: Cantine Gemma 1998 Madonna Della Neve  (Dolcetto d'Alba)
desc: Rich and solid black-cherry fruit greets you and it persists through the palate and finish. Cocoa and herb notes provide interesting accents. The lush and dusty mouthfeel is balanced by good acidity that keeps it lively. Classic Dolcetto at an excellent price. Best Buy.

There's intriguing precision to the nose of this bottling from Chad Melville and family. A laser-sharp line of tart elderberry, black-plum skins and black-cherry skins cut through the dark earth, tar and purple-flower elements. The palate blends approachable black raspberry, dark strawberry and muddled mulberry fruit with touches of coffee and dark cocoa.
Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US

wine_name: Henri de Villamont 2012 Petite Chapelle Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)
desc: This wine has all the tannins you would expect from Gevry, although with some suppleness. They are surrounded by ripe red berry fruits, a rich texture of spice and delicious, refreshing acidity. It's a dense wine, complex and worth aging. Drink from 2018.

wine_name: Vecchie Terre di Montefili 2012  Chianti Classico
desc: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this offers aromas of truffle, underbrush, dark berry and fragrant purple flower. The bright, juicy palate doles out succulent Marasca cherry, black raspberry, clove and a hint of game while supple tannins provide balance and lithe support. It's not loaded with complexity but it is delicious. Enjoy through 2018.

This Chardonnay-based wine (with tiny elements of Viognier and Sauvignon for extra aromatic intensity) opens with pretty golden color and ripe aromas of peach, exotic fruit and dried mineral. There's a soft touch of almond butter or creamy lemon curd as well and the wine is extra smooth and dense on the finish.

wine_name: Valdivieso 2017 Single Vineyard Wild Fermented Barrel Aged Chardonnay (Leyda Valley)
desc: Soft and distant melon and apple aromas reside under heavy popcorn-style oak. In the mouth, this Chardonnay from a warm year is melony and wide. Woody white fruit flavors finish with dry, resiny oak and a touch of oxidation.
Designation: Single Vineyard Wild Fermented Barrel Aged

desc: All crispness and bitter almonds rolled into a coat of green-apple flavor. A slight green quality, too. Minerally and racy like Chablis should be, it is has a lean, mineral-tinged finish. Warms up after a while, but holds onto its flinty, somewhat ungenerous personality.

wine_name: Stone The Crows 2017 Three Twins Vineyard Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
desc: This is a generously expansive and opulent wine, well-integrated, with a supple center of black cherry, cassis and currant. The rich fruit is complemented by baking spice, coconut and a dusting of cocoa powder, the wine lengthy and structured.

This is very textured, with lemon zest and grapefruit acidity. It shows refreshing acidity, with a minerally, tangy and tight feel. With all this tautness, the wine needs to age for another 2–3 years.

Another fine value offering from the NW Wine Company, Westmount scores with this firm, chewy, tasty wine. Redolent with plush plum and cherry fruits, it also carries a bit of Fig Newton-ish cookie flavor. The richness is enhanced and underscored with well-managed, lightly earthy tannins.
Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US

wine_name: Morgan 2003 R&D Franscioni Vineyard Pinot Gris (Santa Lucia Highlands)
desc: This refreshing wine has pretty flavors of peaches, apples, all sorts of garden fruits and even flowers. It drinks just a tad sweet, and is balanced with rich acids.
Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US

desc: Brunate is one of the most famous vineyard sites in Barolo. There is a dirty, dusty nose that carries a whiff of hard cheese. Flavors are of caramel, cherries and underbrush. This is a very good wine that is tight now but will evolve over time.
. A fairly complex blend of toasty oak-framed black cherry, blackberry, bing cherry, spice, herb and vanilla flavors framed in firm, supple tannins. The finish is moderate in length.
This is the freshest apple and citrus-driven wine. It has great fruitiness allied to acidity and a soft, creamy structure. Drink in 2014.

This is a classy wine, showing a deep core of ripe blackberries, black currants and spices, with a smoked meat richness, like crispy bacon. Beyond the flavors is a fine mouthfeel, composed of smooth tannins and a nice bite of acidity.

wine_name: Y Rousseau 2011 The Musketeer Tannat (Russian River Valley)
desc: Bizarre for Tannat, which should be dry, tannic and leathery. Instead, this one's sweet, soft and fruity in raspberry and cherry jam.
Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US

wine_name: Domaine Santa Barbara 2003 Great Oaks Ranch Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
desc: Heavy, soft and tannic, this wine shows black cherry, blackberry flavors and coffee, and is very dry. The cherry finish is attractive, though.
Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US

wine_name: Carol Shelton 2008 Monga Zin, Lopez Vineyard Zinfandel (Cucamonga Valley)
desc: Not a ton of fruit on the nose but a respectable single-vineyard from Zin master Carol Shelton made from organically grown, dry-farmed 92-year-old vines, coaxed into a spicy, brambly wine from a very unusual appellation.
Appellation: Cucamonga Valley, South Coast, California, US

wine_name: Cantina Santadi 2000 Shardana  (Valli di Porto Pino)
desc: Lush and subtle on the nose, with moss and marzipan accenting raspberry, black cherry and pepper flavors. That is maintained on the finish, where chocolate enters the fray. More cushy than precise; serious nonetheless.
Appellation: Valli di Porto Pino, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy

desc: Creamy, soft wine, with hints of wood aging and a light, open texture. There are flavors of pear, pink grapefruit, greengage, along with a final burst of acidity.

The pale salmon color and dry palate are the chief attractions of this light-bodied, dry wine. Berry fruit is subdued but enlivened by citrus and notes of white pepper. It's very fresh and refreshing. Drink as soon as possible.

wine_name: Cave de Cleebourg NV Clérotstein Brut Pinot Gris (Crémant d'Alsace)
desc: While there is some spice here, the wine is more dominated by its acidity, fresh pear and crisp texture. It's lively, fragrant and probably best as an apéritif.
This wine offers aromas of green fruits with high pyrazines. The palate is rubbery and pinching, while the flavor profile is salty and largely fruitless.

Oliverhill seems to have hit the mark in 2008 with their Jimmy Section Shiraz, a seamless blend of blueberries and cream dressed up with savory notes of dark earth and dark coffee. Full-bodied and creamy textured, this densely concentrated wine should be at its best now-2020.

A stony, wet cement-like aromas meets Anjou lime and jasmine touches on the nose of this bottling from a winery recently acquired by O'Neill Vintners. The palate leads with a dollop of acidity and slowly releases lemongrass, Asian pear and ripe nectarine flavors, cut with a tense streak of lime.
Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US

wine_name: Grey Wolf Cellars 2013 Predator Syrah (Paso Robles)
desc: Quite dense and slow to release aromas at first, this bottling, which includes 14% Tempranillo and 6% Tannat, eventually gives scarlet red rose petals, lavender, elderberry and a rich touch of maple-laced bacon fat on the nose. It's much more dynamic and delicious once sipped, with blueberry and blackberry jam, smoked lamb, rosemary and more lavender, bound together by grippy tannins.
Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US

wine_name: Scherrer 2002 Helfer Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
desc: Spicy and rich, this Chard is a bit softer than Scherrer's Fort Ross bottling, and is also leesy and oaky. The flavors are of peaches and apples. It shows a balanced complexity throughout.
Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US

desc: Smoky and supple, aromatic and fine, this elegant and appealing Pinot Noir from a new Ribbon Ridge producer simply seduces. Plum, berry and cherry fruit glides smoothly into soft, polished tannins, with just the right dollop of milk chocolate in the finish.
Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US

desc: A stylish red brimming with plum, sweet tobacco and blackberry flavors. The tannins are wonderfully complex and slippery, and the acidity is soft, so the wine goes down like velvet.

This violet-colored wine has a bouquet of black currant and yellow bell pepper. It offers a nice balance of mellow tannins and integrated acidity, with flavors of blackberry, black cherry, pomegranate, violet and licorice that culminate on a surprisingly bright finish.
92–95 A big wine, with bitter chocolate flavors, and packed ripe fruit. It is intense and very dark, a great success.

Aromas include black berries, coffee, espresso and grilled Mediterranean herbs. The one-dimensional palate lacks the essential fruit richness needed to support the bracing, astringent tannins that give a drying, bitter character. It also displays evident alcohol sensations despite the modest alcohol.

This new project by a former White House videographer recently enlisted Paul Hobbs as a consultant. The promise is already apparent in this wine, with aromas of cedar, cherry extract and pleasant green-pepper elements. Spicy black pepper leads the palate, which finds ripeness in black cherry and balance with leather and coffee.
Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US

desc: Gueules, to be translated as faces, celebrates the men and women behind this wine. Structurally, it is a dense blend of mainly Tannat softened by Cabernet Sauvignon and Pinenc. Blackberry fruits and a solid texture speak of a poerful wine that needs a little more aging. Drink from late 2020.

wine_name: Domaine des Schistes NV Solera White (Rivesaltes)
desc: The bouquet of this wine immediately entices in notes of spiced apricot, orange oil, cinnamon, clove, nutmeg and grilled peach. The palate is slick and slightly sweet, with lush, toasty and spiced stone-fruit characteristics that are coupled with notes of roasted almonds, honeycomb, honey-drizzled apple slices and peach pit. The acidity balances the wine's richness, keeping the sweet sensations in check so nothing is overly cloying or heavy.

wine_name: Terra d'Oro 2018 SHR Field Blend Zinfandel (Amador County)
desc: This interesting and complex wine blends savory and mineral flavors with ripe berries on a full body and smooth, non-tannic texture. The 13% Petite Sirah and 7% Barbera add depth and lift to the Zin.
Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US

wine_name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2013 Clos Saint Urbain Rangen de Thann Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
desc: The subtle, rounded but rather aromatic perfume of peach skins and apricot compote on the nose is utterly seductive—there is a promise of oriental riches and exotic spice but above all pure, glowing peach fruit. The palate is in total focus: while some residual sugar illuminates every last vestige of fruit, there is guiding central force that never lets this slip into the merely opulent. A masterful tightrope walk amidst plump fruit and mineral precision with a finishing, pleasantly bitter edge of marzipan.
Designation: Clos Saint Urbain Rangen de Thann Grand Cru

desc: Citrus and tropical fruit notes are pure, powerful and provide a fine entry to the wine, which dances with melon, green tobacco, pineapple, honeydew and lime flavors. It's big and ripe, with prickly acidity and good complexity. A nice example of Casablanca Sauvignon Blanc with all the zest and ocean influences you should expect.

wine_name: Walter Dacon 2007 Boushey Vineyard Appanage Syrah (Yakima Valley)
desc: Also labeled “Artisan's Reserve” (on back label), this sources fruit from what may well be the best Syrah vineyard in the state. The powerful bouquet brings roasted meats, wild herbs, smoke, seaweed, and mountain berry fruit into play. The same mix of earth, herb, fruit and barrel carries on into the mouth. A Syrah lover's Syrah.
Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US

desc: Oak runs rampant here, swamping the dark red berry fruit with ashphalt, licorice and toast, toast, toast. The modest fruit is hard to find. Quite dry and not well-balanced, with overtly woody tannins.

wine_name: Vignerons de la Sainte Baume 2018 Les Restanques Bleues Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)
desc: With a smidgen of white Rolle in the blend, this wine is as light and bright as a feather. Red fruits are cut by citrus flavors as well as great acidity. Drink the wine now.
Appellation: Coteaux Varois en Provence, Provence, France

desc: Toasty aromas of oak and smoke give a savory framing to the yellow-peach core on this bottling. The smoke shows on the sip as well, where white-peach and dried pineapple flavors also arise.
Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US

desc: A bit soupy and murky at first, and like almost every Arienzo wine previously tasted, there's tree bark, earth and leather to the nose. The palate has a good feel to it, while the flavors are of tea and herbal berry fruit. In addition, dill, coconut, vanilla and resin all make short appearances on the finish.
Aged in 20% new French oak with half of the wine undergoing malolactic fermentation, it's direct and appealing with peach, melon and buttery spices that lead to a warm finish.
Appellation: Ancient Lakes, Columbia Valley, Washington, US

wine_name: St. Supéry 2018 Virtú Estate Bottled Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
desc: A blend of 54% Sémillon and 46% Sauvignon Blanc, this barrel-fermented white is crisp and sophisticated. Flavors of pea shoot, dried herb, peach and green apple mingle effortlessly on the palate, extending long on the ample finish.

wine_name: Hidden Ridge 2009 55% Slope Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
desc: This wine tests the critic's judgment. Is it just a fruit bomb, bursting with cherries, raspberries and blackberries, enhanced with caramelized oak? Or is it a Cab that needs time? All indications suggest the latter. The tannins are thick and hard, courtesy of the vineyard's high altitude in the Mayacamas Mountains, and the acidity is perfect to protect the wine as it evolves in the bottle. Give it until at least 2017.
Great price for a Chard of this quality. Dry, crisp and amply flavored in peaches and cream, tangerines and buttered toast, it has the richness of more costly wines.

wine_name: Bestheim NV Brut Premium Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)
desc: A floral overtone comes with aromas of red and green apples on the nose of this wine. The palate has a creamy mousse and a fruity, rounded midpalate that bounces with lively freshness. The finish is dry and appetizing.

wine_name: Patton Valley 2014 The Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
desc: Ripe strawberry, raspberry, cranberry and red plum flavors, all bright and balanced, impress in this snappy, vibrant wine. The impact of minerally acids outweighs the 25% new oak, at least for now.
Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US

desc: This rich wine is full of dark fruits, rich tannins and a juicy aftertaste. Its tannins and concentration will definitely allow this wine that is both fruity and structured to age. Drink from 2019.
This wine is already soft with great black fruits. Juicy acidity and the tannins give the wine a rich character, with a structure waiting behind all this delicious fruit. Drink from 2023.

Full and ripe with generous aromas of red berry and chocolate, Nadir (a 100% Syrah from Sicily) is a well-crafted wine with chewy, soft tannins and a rich texture. The wine is yielding and succulent with an impressive emphasis on its softness and roundness. It offers excellent value for your money.

wine_name: Durant 2013 La Paloma Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
desc: It's a subtle and light wine, yet it captures the elegantly refined gravitas of the grape. Suggestions of root beer and cola wrap around strawberry fruit. There's a hint of dill and an impression of clean earth. Decant this and it greatly improves.
Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US

wine_name: La Perla del Priorat 2003 Clos les Fites Criança Red (Priorat)
desc: An oily, earthy wine with plenty of belt strap and dark fruit on the nose. The palate is a bit scattered, but there's ample mineral and blackberry to move it forward. The feel is choppy due to pronounced acidity, yet the finish is generally clean and fluid.

Big and brawny, this has bold, ripe fruit aromas and flavors that are shaded by thyme and dill, and backed by very firm tannins and good acidity. The mouthfeel is full and astringent, and the mouth-puckering tannins last on the finish. Enjoy it now with pork ribs or flank steak.

With its densely fruited nose, chocolate and tar-rubber accents, this fairly rustic red has appeal, if not finesse. Flavors are very much in the same range; the mouthfeel is round with just a touch of acidity showing, and the finish displays some nice sweet-and-sour fruit. A good country wine for easy drinking.

A powerfully tannic wine, full of the mineral texture and dark structure of a fine Douro wine. It has rich berry and plum skin flavors with underlining from acidity. The tannins, still young, promise aging. Drink from 2017.

wine_name: Domaine de la Jobeline 2016 Clos des Chanaux  (Mâcon-Verze)
desc: Spicy and nutty is this wine's meme. Punctuated with fresh apple and green-plum flavors, it is crisp while also having some complexity. Drink this attractive wine now.

wine_name: De Loach 2017 La Bienvenue Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
desc: From estate-grown grapes, this small-production red delivers thick, brawny and succulent layers of bright acidity and big-shouldered red and black cherry. Oak and tannin play prominently on the palate, adding texture and weighty complexity.
Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US

wine_name: Quinta da Romeira 1999 Morgado de Sta. Catherina Arinto (Bucelas)
desc: On its own, you might fault this wine for seeming a bit dull and woody. But with the right food pairing, preferably something fruity seasoned with cumin and cinnamon, this wine can sing. Butter and nut aromas take hold, while dry notes of clove, mace and cinnamon echo the food spices and a lemony tang comes through on the finish.
Pure Syrah, this distinguishes itself from the other 2013 Weisinger reds with clear varietal focus. Red licorice, citrus and mixed red fruits lead into a rather chalky, tannic finish.
Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US

wine_name: Cave de Cleebourg NV Clérostein Rosé Pinot Noir (Alsace)
desc: Baked red currant and apple notes create a very appetizing nose. Their tart fruitiness mingles beautifully with the shortbread notes on the dry, refreshing palate and makes this almost impossible to put down. The finish is wonderfully clean and refreshing.

wine_name: Riverbench 2013 Clone 115 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
desc: Baking-spice notes of mace and nutmeg meet with sage, incense, oak and sandalwood components across dark red fruit on the nose of this clonal study. It's delicate in mouthfeel, but heavily spiced with oregano and thyme atop cranberry, beet and raspberry fruits that surround graphite.
Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US

wine_name: Lagarde 2010 Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Luján de Cuyo)
desc: Earthy plum and berry aromas are suggestive of Bordeaux, but the brown sugar and baked fruit angle is all Mendoza. Snappy acidity helps the wine stay trim, while linear raspberry and cherry flavors are red in character. This is gripping with an acidic push to the finish.
Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina

wine_name: Alain Jaume et Fils 2016 Domaine Grand Veneur Les Origines Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
